description:
Gotta give the Tonga Room 4 stars. We arrived on a Wednesday evening after already hitting El Techo and Li Po. No problem getting a table located one ring out from the poolside tables.

The drinks were good (we had the 1944 mai tais and I also tried a zombie), the band on the boat was good, the food was very good (my scallop dish with risotto was great!), and the ambiance can't be matched.

Overpriced for what you get, but you're paying for the experience. Definitely a bucket list item.
author: Peter E.

description:
Been meaning to check out this place for a while. We went there on Sunday night to stop for quick drinks. 
 
The design and the ambiance of this place is phenomenal. The first thing to catch my eyes was that there was a live band floating on the pool area which can't be found at other lounges in San Francisco. 
They have very cute cozy, tropical themed bar that serves really cool drinks with fake coconuts and tiki cups. 

If you weren't here for dinner, you could grab a drink and swing on the side of the pool, and imagine you are dancing in the beach. 
Of course, don't get dizzy with the fantastic ambiance and jump into the pool.  The warning sign just drag you back to the reality.

The drinks are delicious and interesting.

Ordered:
Adult Swim: super refreshing!!
Tonga Kong: A little bit strong, tastes pretty good with coffee liquor. 

Great place for a date or casual hangout.
author: Regina W.

description:
I finally made it to the Tonga Room and what an experience it was!  I knew it would be an expensive night based on reviews so I anticipated spending around $100.   Think of it as an experience though.   What other place in the Bay Area area has a floating band stage?  Think of the ambience too, a wonderfully decorated tiki bar with lightning, thunder and rain (over the pool area, don't worry you won't get wet).  

We went on a Saturday night and  was told the dining area wait was 2 hours and the bar area was 1 hour.  Kind of surprising but there are no reservations for parties under 10.  I put my name down for first available and was lucky enough to not have to wait an entire hour and had an excellent table in the bar with a perfect view of the stage.   Shout out to hostess Jennifer who was very accommodating.  I ordered the Tonga Kong cocktail and the miso salmon.  Both were soooo good!  The cocktail was strong which it better be for the price right?  

The service was great, the food came fairly quickly for how busy it was and the atmosphere was unforgettable.   I walked out spending $80 which included the $15 cover for the band and tax and tip.  This will definitely be a once in a blue moon excursion for me but well worth it.
author: Misty D.

description:
My rating is for the Hurricane Bar in the Tonga Room as I have not come here for food, yet. But the bar area is a lot of fun. They have a ton of Tiki rum cocktails and a dance floor that looks like a pirate ship, over a pool of water, where a band plays on a swaying dock. I mean, does it get anymore Tiki than that? 

The live band plays a mix of popular classics and Hawaiian classics that everyone can dance and sing along to. By 10pm, there is a line wrapping all the way around the hallways outside, so come early to avoid the lines at the bar! 

To eat dinner, there is a reservation charge per head but to come hang out on the dance floor and the bar is a free, fun time.
author: Sydney G.

description:
Great lighting and ambiance, almost feels like the tiki room at Disney, ha! Be prepared to spend an immense amount of money of sugared down drinks and sub par food. You are mostly paying for the overall experience! We ordered a lot of food just between the two of us, our favorite was the coconut shrimp! 

The live music is enjoyable, my friend and I were lucky to have gotten a table with a great view so quickly on a sat night! However, at the end, some idiot jumped in the water and everyone had to leave. They now have signs that say they will fine you a hefty amount if you do that, thanks for ruining it for the rest of us, ha! Come once, get that experience in, don't think I'd go again!
author: Teresa P.

description:
Got here on a  Wednesday just after opening.   The hostess asked if we were there for drinks and appetizers or dinner..   when we said yes to all she said dinner didn't open till 6 but we could have drinks and appetizers in the bar area.   Cool!

We're seated at the bar area and my girlfriend goes back to the hostess to request a table by the center so we can see the water show..   This is when they decided to tell her that if you are seated in the bar you can't be in the waiting list for dinner.   If we want to get our drinks and walk around then we can be on the list..   WHAT KIND OF RULE IS THAT ??? Why couldn't you tell us that when we first arrived??

The happy hour drinks and appetizers were good.   We decided to just stay where we were seated and ordered some larger items to share..  Service was ok but not fantastic.   Prices were higher than expected.   

It was fun to do once but would not make a point to return...
author: Susanne R.

description:
Insane. My husband and I love tiki, but this gives tiki a bad name. It's overcrowded, overcharged, and RUDE staff. This place is an obvious touristy place, which is fine. But I don't think they staff it accordingly, and also because it's touristy, the prices are even more insane. 

Everyone is out for themselves here. There literally was a line wrapped around to the outside (it's in the fairmont hotel). The decked is cool, I'll give em that. The cover band was fine too. But I've had better tiki and a better ambience elsewhere.
author: Giena L.

description:
Not only is this restaurant in a very high and hotel but the service is wonderful and quick the drinks were great and the food is wonderful pricing isn't bad highly recommended
Pat
author: Patrick W.

description:
A friend of mine has been begging me to accompany them to this Tiki Bar in the city. Recently after a Giants game we decided to stop in for a couple after game drinks.

A couple of things that I didn't like about the place. It's only open until 11. And also to get a table it's $10 a person just to sit down. Having six people in our party we decided not to get a table and just grab some drinks from the bar. There's plenty room to stand here the atmosphere is super cool with a dance floor an unswimmable swimming pool with an island in the Middle where a band was playing. Every once in a while you'd hear thunder and lightning and a bunch of water or fake rain would spray down from the ceiling pretty cool. Around and drinks for 6 people ran Us $124 minus tip. Pretty pricey so we decided to just stay for one round.

We sampled the mai tai, the spice killer, the adult swim, and the jungle bird. All the drinks were fruity delicious. Halfway decent poor but still super pricey at that. 

Definitely a cool place to stop in and stand around and sip a nice umbrella type drink located beneath the Fairmont Hotel.
author: James F.

description:
I've been dreaming of going here for over three years since I saw Anthony Bourdain come here on his episode of The Layover.  And oh. my. gosh. Tonga Room was even more amazing than I had imagined.

To find Tonga Room, you can enter the main lobby of the Fairmont hotel, go to elevator and go to level "T."  From there, you will find it at the end of the hallway. I was wowed as I entered this incredibly beautiful hotel adorned with chandeliers, decorative furniture, and high ceilings.  

Upon finding Tonga Room, I was pleasantly surprised to arrive on a Thursday night at 7:30pm with one friend and be seated immediately.  We were seated against the wall but still had a great view of the space.  The walls are a retro fabric wallpaper and the place is tiki themed from floor to ceiling.  The floors are an amazing botanical carpet, the tables and chairs are comfortable and wooden.  There are wooden carved poles on display everywhere, with lanterns hanging from pole to pole, there are boats hanging from the ceiling, and the room is dimly lit with candles on each table.

The star of the show is truly the blue pool in the center of the room with the floating tiki boat. Every 20 minutes or so, there is a rainstorm with real water coming down and the sound of thunder.  It is intoxicating and exciting.  The whole vibe of this place is seriously amazing, not a detail is missed.  

I didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food but they have any awesome drink menu with mostly rum cocktails.  The drinks are a bit on the expensive side starting at $15 on up.  I appreciate how they mark the drinks with skulls and tallies.  The skulls represent how strong the cocktail is and the tallies, how sweet.  It really makes picking a drink easy.  I had the Jungle bird and my friend tried the Mai Tai and the Fog Cutter.  We were both pleased with our drinks and they were definitely strong.

On the floating boat, there was a cover band playing, which was fun.  $10 per person gets added to your tab for being there during the band but it's enjoyable and really adds to the experience.  Really, I'd like to see a surf rock band play here, or karaoke would be fun.

I am so excited that I finally got to try Tonga Bar out.  It is on my list of favorite bars I've ever visited.
author: Annie M.

description:
Wow!  Impressive tiki bar with live music.  I was enjoying the whole vibes here!  Letting loose with tiki drinks, in this crowd and soaking in the music, was lovely! 

Seemingly disguised like outdoors, I felt like I was in the tropic rain with no worries. 

Pirate ship design on the floor to see the performance and surrounding dining area.  Personally, too loud to hear each other for dining.  I was perfectly content with the tiki bar.  Scorpion bowl is a must if you're bringing your crew! 

Pleasant escape to a Hawaiian kind of paradise and away from the city life!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
As soon as I got in line to enter this place, I knew it was a tourist trap. But we had already come so far not to go inside. We had friends visiting from out of town so it was more reason for us to check this place out after Anthony bourdain had talked about it.

The line to get in moved pretty quickly. We arrived around 10pm or so on a Saturday night and waited less than 30 mins. I liked that the line was indoors, so we did not have to brave the sf cold. To get table service, it was an additional $15 per person since they had live music, so we opted for standing room only.

It took us a while to get drinks, which was expected, and drinks were expensive, also as expected. Inside the bar it was small and dingy. What looked like an extravagant pool on social media was a small pool of water in the middle of the room. It was underwhelming to say the least.

Everyone in my group agreed that the live entertainment was the best part. You could tell the band were not professionals, but we enjoyed a few of their songs. 

Also to note, seemed like an older crowd getting down in this place...our group was in our late twenties and early thirties and we felt wayyyy too young. We left after each having one drink.

A nice thing to check off the bucket list, nothing else to see here.
author: Tiffany S.

description: This place was cool! Food is hawian themed. The indoor pool with the live band was very entertaining. Cost to sit at a table was $15 a head or free to stand at the bar or the dance floor. When the band played there were water pipes that simulated raining it was such a cool envirionment right inside the fairmont hotel
author: Chris H.

description:
I love the atmosphere here! It's for sure an SF must visit. The live music and drinks are amazing.
The menu is basic and small but tastes great.

Only downside is drinks are sooooo expensive, we spent $80 on 4 drinks, $15 a person to enjoy the live music and food on top of that. Its not local friendly but great for a one time experience.
author: Dunia M.

description:
This place is located at the bottom of a hotel, once you enter you make your way towards the elevators and go down to floor T.

The place itself has an overall fun vibe, although the crowd skews a bit older. The drinks were a bit pricy (I got one for about ~$20) but they were pretty strong and overall not too bad.

I'd come mostly for the atmosphere, they play a lot of older, easy to sing-a-long to music and the place is well decorated and cool looking. Great place to hang out and drink with friends!
author: Tyler T.

description:
This was a mood lifesaver and great closer to my bachelorette vacation. It was honestly our "Plan B" for the tiki bar adventure 'cause I'd already been here about 6 years ago with my aunt and uncle, but my fiancé always had it on his wishlist as a destination. 
We had already read up on previous reviews, and from my experience years ago, we didn't have high expectations. We couldn't make reservations 'cause that's a privilege for the Fairmont Hotel guests, so we went early (shortly after getting denied access to another tiki bar 'cause they posted a last minute private event). My group was there about 30-45 minutes before opening time, and were one of the first there. Once the hostesses opened up, they asked if we were there for Happy Hour, and BAM! We're seated. Lesson of this: Be there early! 
No joke that 15 minutes after getting seated, the bar was crowded along with seating. Y'all should also look over the menu, so you can order as soon as your server introduces himself with glasses of water. That's if you're in a rush. 
The setting definitely makes our Vegas tiki bars look like small, adult playgrounds, so it's picturesque for the tiki aficionados. The tiki mugs and other souvenirs are on the expensive side as well, but I guess it wouldn't matter if you're a hardcore collector. LOL. It even made my fiancé feel slightly deterred, so my sister and brother-in-law bought him the Boat Bowl for about $55 (includes tax) as a present for being such a great sport during the trip. 
Taking advantage of Happy Hour, we ordered about 7 tiki drinks and 2 Pupu Platters (3-4 pieces of about 4 different appetizers). Total came out to be around $200 (excluding gratuity).
author: Agnes S.

description: This place is very pricey- not meant for any casual occasion! I came here for my friends 21st birthday with her family. The menu consists of a variety of asian dishes. I enjoyed the food overall, and the serving size is huge. There are live performers in the middle of the room, and an artificial rain comes every 15 minutes. There's a small dance floor as well. I tried a few of their alcoholic beverages, and they were all tasty too me; NOTE: They're pretty strong!
author: Tammy W.

description:
This place was...interesting 

Before even walking in, we were told by a group of guys outside to expect at least a 30-min wait. 

The place is actually located on the ground floor next to the hotel gym. From the pictures, I thought it was rooftop or an open space but it's fully enclosed (kinda wish if was rooftop). We probably waited 20 minutes to get in but what was interesting is that if you're dining you pay a cover for "entertainment", but if you're not dining you get in free. Is if just me or does that make no sense at all. 

I, of course, was dressed up thinking this was a fancy kinda place but there were at least three girls in line with Berkinstocks and two dudes with backpacks! Ughhh so yeah you can pretty much wear whatever you want. 

Any who, we were just going for a little bit of dancing and a drink or two. All their specialty cocktails have an "islander" theme, which isn't my jam. Very overpriced since I'm sure sugar is the primary ingredient and not alcohol. 

Music selection was pretty cheesy and reminded me of prom (minus the Top-40 tracks). Interesting mix of a crowd too. We only stayed for about an hour. Just wasn't my kind of place. 

Cute shot glasses though!
author: Adelina M.

description:
I finally got you experience what others have been gushing about.

The drinks are strong, the air is thick with electricity and if you are on the prowl you could probably find yourself a catch.

We had spent a long day out since our trip to San Francisco was a short one, so my radar skills were on the shelf that night, but i picked up a few signal, I was just to tired to care. Lo

This is a busy bar, and so to find seating is almost impossible, we stood at a standing community table and one of us went to order drinks.  I chose the Mai Tai, it was strong, smooth, and went down easily, my friend got the Zombie and there is a reason it's called that, one of those drinks is dangerous anymore than that and you may not know who you or where you are in the morning.

I of course loved the sound of Thunder & the rainfall in the center of room,  it's amazing to know this restaurant/bar once housed the Hotel Pool and was reconstructed and once designed by a MGM set designer back in the 70's & 80's, very flashy then , now it's decorated like a ship and it's a fun experience I think everyone should try. 


If you are claustrophobic be warned, in the bar it's a sea of people (no pun intended) and you might find it hard to adjust, but if you can take a deep breath and persevere it will be worth it.
author: Rachel W.

description: Drinks are good. The short ribs were awful, do not get them. My friends got the scallops and those were good. There's a $15 per person fee for the band, not worth it. I will not be coming back and I do not recommend this place.
author: Cynthia D.

description: I have always wanted to come here and I finally did!!! The atmosphere is awesome!! I love the whole tiki decor of this bar/ restaurant. The drinks were good but pricey!!! We didn't stay for dinner because at 8pm there is a $15/ person entertainment charge. I'm very glad we came though!! I'll definitely come back to try the food.
author: Kyle D.

description:
I drink HARD - straight tequila, bourbon, whiskey and rye. But my wife of thirty years wanted to hit this place, so since I want to make it to thirty one years, I play along with a smile.   

As other's have said it's in the Fairmont atop of Nob Hill.  I figure this grand old dame with its long history probably has its act together and I trudge along my wife who is now giddy as a school girl waiting to get their in our cab.

We walk through the door, she thinks heaven, I think Disney Land.  But I love Disney Land and this one serves stiff drinks with umbrella's.  So after about seven of these concoctions I start to see the light and realize that I'm having a good time amongst the natives.

So in short if you need a leg up, a reason to start your party slowly (like partying too hard the night before), this is a great place to begin your drinking.
author: Ronald D.

description:
Such a fun environment to be in, kinda takes you away and makes your forget that you're in SF. You can grab some drinks and stand or get a table and dine next to the water area in the middle. In the evenings, they sometimes have live music as well (which you have to pay $10/person, so if you want to avoid that, make sure you pay and leave before the time of the event).

Because it's so popular, the waiting time for a table is usually pretty long, over an hour. And they have a rule that, if you get a table, you have to order one entree per person. So if you're there more to grab a couple of drinks and order some appetizers, getting a table isn't the way to go. 

While the drinks are good, they're also pretty pricey, with each drink $3-5 more expensive than at most places. It's more for the atmosphere and experience.
author: David K.

description: Went out here after work with a few of my coworkers and had to wait in line to get in, it was pretty popular. We decided to grab drinks at the bar then get a small table to get some appetizers and order more drinks. The service was just okay, they were very busy so it was understandable. The food was good, we all loved the fried rice. Drinks were very good and strong. We all liked the music and environment of the place. We really enjoyed ourselves and definitely will go again! Just a heads up, it gets packed and the wait for a table is a long wait, I think it's worth it :)
author: Shanitte N.

description: Tonga Room oh how I love you. The atmosphere, the drinks, what is there not to love?  I got to Tonga Room about 20 min before they opened and there was already 10-15 people in line.  It ended up only being a couple groups.  So I was really about 3rd or 4th in line.  I opted to stand at the bar since I was just having a drink.  I ordered the Jungle Bird.  It was tasty and a deal at only $10 during happy hour.  If you like tiki bars this is a must visit when in San Francisco.
author: Heather N.

description:
As a Tiki bar connoisseur (but its gotta be a REAL one, yknow?), I'd been dying to go here ever since I found out it existed. Located in the ever swanky Fairmont Hotel, the Tonga room is a legit relic of Tiki goodness. What used to be a pool was converted to a themed bar in the '40s and seems rather largely unchanged since. It's a pretty wild set up, the likes of which you tend to see in a Disney setting. They float a raft on the lagoon pool to situate live music, and there's even a 'rain' effect that comes and goes over the water for all of your instagram needs.

I came here exactly at 5pm open on a Friday night and it was already pretty packed. We got a table at the bar and ended up next to an elder couple who were told they had to wait at the bar for a half hour before being seated to eat dinner (!? kinda weird, considering the place JUST opened...) but that was fine because they were sweet and ended up buying our first round of drinks out of the kindness of their hearts (thank you!!!). The drinks themselves were lovely and tasty. At around $15~ mark they're what I expected, tiny umbrella and wedge of pineapple kind of presentations but in normal highball glasses. I had the Spice Killer and the Tonga Kong and both were genuinely great. Strong and sweet as promised. 

We considered dining but ended up deciding against it due to a couple of reasons. Beware- there's a fee to be seated at any table (a set price for the live music), and the food prices are on the expensive side in general ($25 ~ $30 entrees). There's also apparently a wait whether you get there on time or not (and no reservations under a party of nine or something?) Though if you've made it this far, it's probably worth the splurge.
author: Jenna I.

description:
Oh my gosh I loved this place I went here for a girls night out on a Thursday about 9pm 
The place was pack ! You have to pay for each person in your party to sit in the room with the performances which has the water in the middle with the rain super cute it was so worth it to me! Wait wasn't to long the food is a bit over priced to me Chicken wings are good.. the hurricane drink is okay not worth the price... your basically paying for the atmosphere..
author: Pretty P.

description:
We arrived at the Tonga Room a little after 5 pm on a Friday night and there were already a number of people at the bar. Since they no longer take reservations, we were hoping to get in within an hour but no such luck. Their dining hours dont begin until 6 pm but their bar area opens at 5 pm. We decided to pass on the 2 hr waiting time.

For the awesome decor inside, I give the Tonga Room 5 stars. But I dont understand the concept of opening an hour prior to letting people dine at the restaurant... so you can make people wait a minimum of an hour to be seated?  Oh. And a cover charge per person is added to your bill at 8 pm for when there is a band. If I merely wanted a drink, I might give them another try. But, I'm less inclined to dine here because of the built-in waiting.
author: Aileen M.

description:
Wow. Cool place and food Was good but pricey. Bringing the rating down for the fact that the guy cleaning tables refilled my water with a half filled water glass from another table he just cleaned. Gross. Needless to say, despite being dehydrated from walking the hills
Of San Francisco all day, I didn't drink water till I got back to my hotel room. Music was good but dude was gross.
author: Ben T.

description:
Wouldn't waste my time here, so many better options in the city. I visit San Fran a lot, this trip was 72hrs in the city with my sister visiting from England, so I wanted to make the experiences memorable. After reading about this bar in magazines, we made the trek up the steep hills, excited to experience the Tonga room. First to arrive on a Sunday we quietly sat outside. By the time the doors opened there were approx 13 ppl waiting in small groups. The hostess was incredibly rude, she asked us to line up in a straight line, before closing the door and going back inside to loudly talk about how stupid we all were outside! Very unnecessary seen as everyone was quietly stood in one straight line as she had requested! The reviews say rude but this was unpleasant. We ignored this, sat down, and immediately experienced the "rain storm". Very gimmicky, the idea of ordering a $20 drink to watch water fall from a sprinkler system in the roof did not appeal so we left. My advice - walk over the street to the beautiful - Top of the Addy, inside the intercontinental hotel and enjoy a drink with a spectacular view of San Fran and pleasant servers, happy for your business! 

Ps sign at entrance of the Tonga room - $10 per person table charge if they have live music.
author: Jessica H.

description: This place looks fun but not so much.  Once you put in the reservation at the table, be sure to check your phone constant constant.  If you miss their text message by 10 minutes, they will downgrade you to a really crappy location at the instead of a real table.  We missed the text message to come to front desk since our table was ready.  We missed it by 15 minutes. We had to wait for 45 minutes and ordered alcohol at bar and did not notice the messages.  But they can't accommodate us with a decent table.  Quite a disappointment.  Well.  Their drinks are good.  But overall, horrible customer service mainly pertaining to the front desk person.  Seriously!
author: Lap L.

description:
Cool bar to experience once, but definitely not one I would go to often. It's a beautiful bar with cool effects (rain!) and a pool (nobody swims in it, in case you're wondering, haha). It's quite touristy, and unless you know someone who can get you in immediately, be prepared to wait in line for a while. Fortunately I had some friends who were already in there and had a reservation, so I didn't need to wait.
The punch bowl really does the job, because it's sweet, yet strong. I had a fun time, but it was more of an experience kind of thing. I wouldn't be back unless I'm with others who have never been there before and/or want to go there.
author: Christina W.

description:
I just had to come here! On a Saturday night it's quite busy and there is a band on the boat playing fun music to drink to! 
The bartenders are quick to get everyone's orders, even with the huge crowds. Surprising. 
There's no cover charge to get into the bar but, if you want to sit at a table, there is a $15 entertainment fee( whatever that means). 
All their drinks a tiki-type drinks and rum based and each cost around $15+. They do offer punch bowls for larger groups and, I think, are a better deal starting at $56.
The whole room flashes with lighting and it rains over the "pool".
This was a pretty sweet place to hang at and I would highly recommend checking it out!
author: Ada J.

description:
Issa Vibe at the Tiki Bar! Live music is a plus! Wish the dance floor was bigger though to accommodate the amount of people.

Packed, but I would say it consistently took longer than expected when re/ordering drinks. The drinks were great and all, it just took awhile every time we ordered.

Pro-Tip: Was an hour wait for a table near the bar (you can still order food at this table), which does NOT have a view of the band. Plan to arrive even EARLIER for a dinner table as they have a good view.
author: Bryan R.

description:
I like the idea of Tonga room. It's a place for people to have a sort of island experience without leaving the mainland. But to me, it was a tacky, overpriced experience and I'm glad I only paid for one drink. The two stars are because the drinks are strong. But my drink became bitter after a few minutes because the lime thrown in it was not ripe at all.

The food consisted of East Asian and Southeast Asian food thrown on an uninspired, and definitely not authentic menu. We ordered the Pupu platter, garlic asparagus, fried rice, and 48 hr Korean short rib. Read the rest if you want to read the details of what is probably one of the worst meals I've ever had.

For $39, the pupu platter came with oily egg rolls, overdone chicken wings that tasted like frozen section reheated food, kalua pork rolls, breaded skewered coconut shrimp, and ahi tuna poke tostadas. The pork rolls are okay, the coconut shrimp was made well, and so were the tostadas, though it's really hard to mess up raw tuna. Asparagus tasted like burned oil. Fried rice was bland. I regret even putting the "short rib" in my mouth because the texture of it was super unpleasant. It was too soft, like it disintegrated as I chewed it. Like what happens if you marinate meat in lime for too long. It wasn't for me. The entire dinner for 2 cost $150 (with a drink for two.) To me, eating here was not worth it, but if you have money to blow go right ahead.
author: Melanie F.

description:
Extremely cool bar, there is a big pool in the center of the room. Tables around the water cost $10, and there is a nice dance floor in front of the water. A live band plays straight across the dance floor on a floating boat. Drinks here are a bit overprices but are definitely worth it, ordered a Mai Tai at the bar and it was made to perfection. The atmosphere is very nice, it gives a feel of being outdoors, very relaxing.

My date got a little lost first while trying to find the bar. It is actually located inside the Fairmont hotel. There are signs within the hotel to guide you to the entrance. However the search were certainly worth it, I would definitely recommend checking this place out!
author: Karan L.

description:
My husband and I have been wanting to go to this place since almost 2 years now. Once we went, we couldnt find a parking spot and didn't want to spend a lot on parking lot, other time we found parking, went over to see that the bar had been booked for an event and we couldn't enter. Third time was the charm! It was our wedding anniversary and we drove down at 6 pm, hoping to catch the happy hour there. It was a weekday, yet the place was quite packed. You can't make reservations through phone, once you get there, you can put your name down on a list and get texted once your table is ready. Once you receive your text, you have 10 minutes until your table is gone. 

When we went, there was an hour wait. We were told that we could wait at the bar until the table was ready. The bar was a sweet surprise. No bar stools, no cramped up area. In fact, the bar was quite an open area where we could hang out. It was open to one side of the water pool in the center and the happy hour was still on! The drinks here are pretty potent and very tropical, just as we expected from a tiki bar. The happy hour prices were the best part, we got cocktails, each for $10. We had almost 5 drinks and then got he table. There was a little disappointment here. I had requested the server to give us a table on the water side since it was our anniversary. She said all the water side tables are reserved for hotel guests. Mostly all tables were empty and we were given a table quite away from the water front, which was a little sad. We ordered food, it was average.

At 8:30 pm, live music started and really set the atmosphere up! Its a lovely place for a nice evening with some strong drinks and nice tiki bar feel. Will definitely go back here, specially to enjoy the happy hour while we wait for a table :)
author: Roma M.

description:
Very crowded on a Friday nite, so yes, there's a wait time, must order food by 930pm, drinks are OK. 
Sincerely,
Mai Tai
author: Tye H.

description:
We came to the Tonga room because my boyfriend loves tiki bars. Lol we walked into the Fairmont hotel and the hotel itself was beautiful. It reminded me of Home Alone 2 when Kevin went to NYC. At the time they had a booth set up with some champagne. 

Anyways we walked around trying to figure out how to get to the Tonga room. With some help of the inter webs, we managed to find our way downstairs into its secret hiding spot. We got there about 45 minutes earlier, but we were glad we did because a long line formed rather quickly. I found it funny though because people were coming into the line already holding drinks. They were pregaming haha. 

So got in and we're seated in the front half of the room because towards the back was for dinner service. But we only stayed for happy hour. Boyyyy it was PACKED! Thank goodness we were the first ones in the line though because we got a table while other people in the back of line had to pack around the bar. The place itself was awesome. Loved the theme and the water feature. 

For drinks and apps we ordered, something along the lines of someone walking into the luau. I can't really remember the name and something Kong lol sorry I can't remember the names right now. But the thinks we're pretty solid. They packed a punch for sure. We shared the drinks between three people and they got us in a good place. Mhm. We also ordered some spicy chili edamame and calamari. They were delicious. I couldn't stop eating them. 

I would probably come here again but only for happy hour haha.
author: Ellen H.

description: Great dancing and hangout vibes on the pirate ship based theme. Cocktails were decent too. Happy I landed up here at some point
author: Netri S.

description: Have been waiting for years to come here.  Finally climbed the hill from Union Square to the Fairmont only to be told "we are closed for a private event", come back again.  Sorry NO!  I would give it a ZERO if it was possible!
author: Dr B.

description:
Super cool place! The decor of this place is top notch, they really stuck to the beach/tiki these well. There's a huge pool of water in the middle, with a boat at the end which serves as a stage for live music. The music on the night that I went was great, a nice mix of old hits and current ones too. 
For drinks, we got one of the bowls to share. Forgot what it was called but it made grapefruit, coconut and other citrusy things it in. Yo the drinks at this place are hella STRONG. Not great for taste but good for your wallet in terms of dollar to alcohol ratio haha
One downer is that the tables with seats here are free for hotel guests only, otherwise it's 15 per person.
author: Sijia Z.

description:
Tldr - this is actually the worst food I've ever paid to eat. And it's expensive.

Ok first off - $10 cover. Interesting business model for a restaurant.. It doesn't seem that they have problems getting people in so they're definitely getting away with it but shouldn't the cover be for people not dining? I dunno for sure.

Atmosphere - it's like.. OK. It's cool looking all luao pirate themed or whatever but it feels a little gimmicky. I felt like i was at a 10 year old's birthday party at an arcade or something like i straight up thought a magician or some shit would pop out of one of the corners. 

Food - Oh dear lord. It was so disgusting... like actually some of the worst food i've had in my life. I do have a good number of negative reviews on my yelp page but this manages to trump all of them in terms of how bad it was. AND it was one of the most expensive places I've been! This is like the epitome of the SF bouj "fancy" places with terrible food.

Ok so everything was covered in syrup. When I say syrup, i mean like... when you pick up anything it feels like you picked up a waffle covered in maple syrup. that's how sticky your fingers become. It's got that glaze that is popular at shitty chinese restaurants but somehow it tastes significantly worse.

A friend of mine got lemon chicken. Oh my god, legit one of the worst things I've had. Have you ever had the lemon loaf pound cake at starbucks? Imagine that but the taste of the frosting on it... and now cover a piece of dry chicken in syrup with that exact taste. IT WAS SO BAD omg. i had half a bite and wanted to die.

The best thing we got was on the appetizer tray thingy and it was a spring roll. It tasted like it was premade and delivered frozen.. but somehow it is worse than shitty chinese restaurant spring rolls which are definitely pre-made and frozen. Me and a friend shared the wings, and they were really dry and sticky as well. The dipping sauce (tomato based) for the wings was not bad.

If you are in SF and think about coming here I PLEASE URGE YOU DO NOT GO HERE. There's so much better food in San Francisco for little a fraction the price. Only downside of that is you wont get the ridiculous disney world esque ambiance... if you in to that
author: Samraaj B.

description:
WHAT A WASTE!  Do not waste your time.  While they claim they created the famous Mai Tai, I beg to differ.  For $17 a pop, I did not find it exceptional.  I actually fund it to be sub-par...........

The restaurant itself was interesting.  It was tiki meets shipwreck.  Standing room only at the bar. They do not have any chairs/stools located around their bar.  

There is a stage in the pool for a live band to play.  Typically they start at 8:15pm nightly.  Make sure to take you drink over to the railing overlooking the pool.  Ever 30 minutes a rain storm happens for 2 minutes on the outskirts of the pool.  Its a major attraction while there.  

Small dance floor near the pool too.  Plenty of seating for those interested in dining.  I cant vouch for the food as I didn't try it.
author: Lea B.

description: The anticipation of finally being able to go to the Tonga room! I've always wanted to come here, being half Tongan I remember my mom wanting to go with the family when we were younger but for whatever reasons we were never able to bring her here. Now more than ever I decided why not life's way to short and with pure luck of staying at the Fairmont for the weekend it was fate!  I have to say my initial thought if the tonga room was it would be tropical, reminiscent of the islands and that the cuisine would be island food. We arrived promptly at 5pm (opening time) because the hotel priority reservation was already booked. The hotel advised us to show up before opening and asked to be seated at the first come first serve. That's what we did and we are able to have a quick complimentary wine and cheese snack from the hotel and we were notified that our seats were available within 15 mins. Ok so brace yourself as you walk in it feel like you are stepping into a mini island. The decorations and vibe is so islander and it's almost as if you escaped to the friendly island of Tonga  we were warmly greeted by our hostess that took us to our seat by the water and boat (where live music is played.) I loved the whole scene, the water, palm trees and rain every 30 mins was so soothing. The bad starts from 8pm till midnight and I thought they were great, however it's an island place it would have been great to here more island music instead of 80's band covers but good none the less. Now on the the service and the food, that is the reason for my rating. The service felt rushed and if you know anything about be islands nothing is rushed and your always greeted warmly. We received rushed treatment and the greetings were mediocre. The food was total Asian fusion with pork being the only Polynesian cuisine? As an islander I felt that they could add more Polynesian cuisine to their menu to get the whole experience. In our culture food is love. We show our appreciation for every event or holiday with food and this food was really over priced and not great tasting. The drinks however were great. I would advise eating elsewhere and coming for the drinks and scenery. It's really such a beautiful place to be lacking the island spirit and island cuisine. Would I come back? For the scenery, drinks and if they switched the music genre yes, for the food no. It's really a beautifully decorated place and a must stop site see if your ever in SF!
author: Maya A.

description: The misses fabulous! I enjoyed every song they played! The trouble started at the bar. Two bartenders for a mob!  Luckily we signed up for a table! $15 entrance fee for the band that was well worth it! A forty five minute wait for a table turned into fifteen. We had the adult swim drink for $15 . It was delicious. We ordered the tango pupils platter. It was good too! $32! The place is amazing with their tiki theme and rainstorm! The pool is refreshing to look at. Everyone seemed to be having a good time! The chicken wings were not hot. We were also at our table but we are old. This place is for the young but the band was awesome!
author: Teofila R.

description: We had a pretty nice time until the band came on - don't get me wrong, they're pretty talented, the music volume was just set so loud it was uncomfortable.
author: Z H.

description: We went recently early on Saturday night, a party of three as we had a nearby party to attend at 8pm.  It was crowded but we got on the list for a dinner table and, with a little aggressive work with the maitre'd we we seated pretty quickly.  The drinks were great (Singapore Sling's) and the food (coconut shrimp, wok-fired whole snapper and the beef short ribs) was very good.  We went out of convenience after 30 years and were happy we did.  All servers etc were great.
author: Jude L.

description:
The atmosphere was fun. I was most excited to try the food, but it turned out to be really disappointing. We had the mahi mahi...the tiki drinks were pretty good. Overpriced!! If your not staying at the Fairmont there is a cover charge. 
A great place for out of town visitors but after you've done it once. I'd never go back again. 
One of those cross off your list of things to do places. 
The tiki themed bar was just ok! Go for drinks only
author: Tijuanna D.

description:
This is a FAIRMONT restaurant   And it sure did not feel like it. You have big expectations from a world class hotel and they were quickly killed. First, there is a cover charge after 8pm!!! Wtf. Seriously.. I get it if you're there for the band and just grabbing a couple drinks, but if you're there for dinner, it should be included. 

We had the When a monk walks into a luau drink for 2... over $30 for it. It was quite boozy and tasty but small. Probably the only thing I liked about our experience. First night in SF and we are here. We decided to order the platter to share. What a. Waste! The spring rolls had no taste. The ribs had absolutely no meat on them. The tuna tartare chips were the best thing there which isn't saying a lot. Deep fried crab claws were overly battered and not tasty. 

Only giving them 2* because our server was nice and the atmosphere was good. Food was huge disappointment.
author: Patricia F.

description: Went here for a friend's going away. All the food was pretty good and the price for the main course meals wasn't too bad. I had the salmon and it was cooked perfectly. However the drinks were extremely sweet but strong and a bit overpriced. The live music on the boat was very entertaining. This place is good for groups and it's best to come for dinner between 7-8pm. We were surprised to see a long line upon leaving around 10:30pm. The bar was packed and it definitely fills to capacity fairly quickly.
author: Sandra F.

description:
I want to give this place a great review on the appearance alone, but my experiences just require me to do otherwise. On one hand, this place has a lot of neat charm, like being inside a Disney ride with the thunder, rain, and kitschy decor, but the prices are horrible and definitely not upfront.

Our problems started because we asked the hostess if there were any vegan options on the menu. A manager overheard us and said that they would sub tofu for meat in a dish, and we were assured that they could accommodate us. Once seated, we told that the server had spoken to the manager and was aware of our dietary needs. So, we each ordered stir fried veggies without the normal oyster sauce, and the server asked if we wanted the tofu in it, so we said yes. At no time were we told that this would be an upcharge. OH but what an upcharge it was! Not only we were charged the full $20 for stir fried veggies, but we were charged $10 extra for a bit of tofu added. EACH. Each plate of veggie and tofu cost $30! This was more than most of the meat dishes on the menu, and absolutely not how we were presented in the beginning. 

Even with the cute atmosphere, this was insane. And, to make matters worse, if we had not left within 10 minutes of when we did, we were going to be charged an extra $10 (each, of course) for "entertainment." 

Nope. It's cute, but not worth that price!
author: Chanele R.

description:
TIKI Stop To Close Day Of Museum Exhibits

SITREP

After a perfect Sunday to hit SFMOMA (San Francisco Museum of Modern Art) first and catch Edvard Munch exhibit, we then stopped at the Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar ("Tonga") which doesn't open til 5pm.

THE PLUSES

I'll start with what Tonga excels at:

* TIKI DECOR!  I have to admit- of places I've been to in Bay Area - including Trader Vic's, Smuggler's Cove, Forbidden Island, and even The Jungle Bird in Sacramento - Tonga really seems to have THE most Tiki-authentic environment.

* Incredible space!  

    From main bar area...
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=DogQPxkmkvPMY7d1zgg2pg&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

   ..to main & two side dining areas, Tonga has lots of room to potentially satisfy many patrons.
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=i7yAZmZHTEvWzcnjSpPKzw&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

* Rain Forest & Lagoon!  Complete with Thunder & Lightning noises and ACTUAL FALLING WATER from ceiling pipes (intentional, just to be clear) it makes for a fun ambience.
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=jsPgDvqge0JNG0j02YDj4A&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

* Floating Band Stand!  Providing ambience at far end of rain forest lagoon - and when band is playing, it will move forward in lagoon.

* "IF ONLY" - I wasn't that impressed with "Main" dish selections (I tried my friends' Halibut and his wife's Wok), but I managed to still cobble together a decent dinner with the "Starter" Crab Cake ($18) and the Pineapple Fried Rice ($10 - two excellent individually offered items. 

      In fact, *PROPS* for what could be THE BEST crab cake I've ever had!  If rating was just left to crab cake, 5 Stars all the way!
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=SftjtcBw9KWKbX-SVzex_A&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

MORE THAN JUST DECOR MATTERS

So if ambience & crab cakes were all that mattered, Tonga would easily be a "5-"star rating. Unfortunately, based on our recent experience, it only deserves a "3"-star overall rating, in that:

= Our "Jet Pilot" and "Zombie" drinks were way WAY overpowered with Absinthe.  When traditionally done, there should only be a few drops for flavor, but here it felt like there was a shots worth in each.  
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=j-2D20_H-iPKok5BdwZGLw&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

= I can't complain too much about the taste of the 1944 Mai Tai (it's on point), but you get a LOT more bang (ounces) for your buck at Trader Vics, and for substantially less cost ($10 as opposed to $16 here).
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tonga-room-and-hurricane-bar-san-francisco?select=BLdPOKmIvsteTLz9cD45WQ&userid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w

* MENU LIMITATIONS - DINNER "START"-FAIL: we got to Tonga by 4:45pm to make their 5pm opening (because we knew from friends you could expect a line, and sure enough, there was) - but disappointment to find out that dinner was not being served 6pm (why do places do this? You're open at 5pm, START SERVING DINNER).

* APPETIZER-*FAIL*: So. We scan the appetizer & starters menu deciding to enjoy their signature pu pu appetizer platter. However, THAT ONE ITEM - still on the menu, mind you, without any notations to the contrary - was not available. It's a cheap trick to dupe diners to your establishment based on signature items, deny them, and then force people to stick around for dinner once they've already made the inordinate investment in time and LYFT to get there in the first place.  

 Because of small crowd at 5pm, we could have been in and out by 6:15pm if dinner had started at 5pm But because crowd density has increased by 6pm - and servers weren't particularly great at checking back - we couldn't order our dinners until 6:20pm and so we weren't out of Tonga until 8pm, missing another evening engagement (OUR issue, agreed, but based on an inconsiderate Tonga practice which now makes us very reticent to ever go back nor plan them in our itinerary in the future).

OTHER DINING METRICS

* Though quiet at 5pm, by 8pm noise level is quite substantial.  
* Our dining area was right next to the bar area, and understand that many hotel patrons just choose to grab a domestic beer ($7) and come stand on the open dance area between the bar and the lagoon to have loud conversations - it is what it is;
* Parking: don't bother - if you aren't staying here at Fairmont - or aren't a short LYFT ride away from another nearby hotel or home, better rethink your dinner plans. 

THE LOWDOWN

If you are staying at the Fairmont - or are close by - Tonga is a nice, very local offering to enjoy. But with other better local Tiki venues nearby in Bay Area, don't go far out of your way just to come here considering inconvenience, disappointments & overall costs.
author: Michelangelo S.

description:
The very old school Tonga Room a total SF institution where tourists and some locals love to go. With its Tiki inspiration and sporadic Rain fall its a whole world of its own. Now its very busy from the guests at the hotel so I recommend reservations.
Break down-you can walk in and stand at the bar (literally). To sit its a $15 cover charge.
This is the crazy packed area the later it gets.
The dinning area is fine and less full.
There is a long line if you walk in. Here the ambiance of child like fun. Lots of age groups even kids dancing around the little dance floor. Older gents, teens and 20s, 30s, 40s,. All ethnic back grounds. And even 4-5 years olds.
Drinks are cheesy cute tiki style and pack a punch. They are also costly. Some are huge for 4 people. 
The food here is not their forte as everything was over salted and tasteless. The walnut shrimp was so bad we sent it back. Appetizers were just ok.
Service was amicable and speedy for being so busy.
The fun part was the awesome live band and the people dancing around having a good time. We had a great time people watching. Lots of selfie action going on non stop, so much so after some drinks 3 people ended up loosing their cell phones in the water and the poor staff kept having to fish out the phones it was hilarious!!! 
Pricey but fun, stiff drinks, good service not good food. This is a great place to hang out and drink. Parking is super tough if you don't use valet.
author: Theresa G.

description: What a FUN UNIQUE place! The best analogy I have is it's like Rainforest Cafe for adults! It's not cheap but you will smile the whole time and you will leave full and tipsy. We ordered several drinks, including "A monk walks into a bar" which served all four in our party. We ordered a variety of appetizers and main dishes and they were all flavorful. Ignore the haters--treat yourself to this experience at least once.
author: Christy C.

description: We were wowed as soon as we walked in. Tonga room is located in the Fairmont hotel. We went on a Thursday night. The decor is very elaborate. You feel like your on sea. In fact they have a pool in the middle of the room. There was live music. The musicians played on a boat in the pool. The drinks were delicious and strong. The atmosphere demanded dancing and dance we did. I would have given this place 5 stars for the atmosphere alone. The food was also good
author: Jinel G.

description:
This place is amazing from the fun and friendly environment to the delicious food.
The Tonga Room is a place you can have a great time with live music.
author: Wendy S.

description:
The decorations, ambiance and live music here is awesome. There's a standing bar room if you're interested only in the drinks, which I suggest you come here for at least once if you're in the bay area. There's a live cover band in the middle of the pool which adds a nice party atmosphere to the place, especially on the dance floor. The only bad thing about the bar area is it gets really crowded. You've been warned.

I ordered the Mai Thai and it was more on the sweet side. It's not as strong as you would expect paying close to 20$ but it's more about taking in the environment. My initial impression of this place was 4 stars but after sitting on it, the ambiance can't make up for the overpriced drinks. Tonga is pricey but will give you a night to remember.
author: Steve H.

description: Amazing live music and drinks .Little costly as they charge extra for the live music per person. Service was fast and great.
author: Isha R.

description: Beautiful location. Ambience is awesome and staff is great. Bar has everything you need and live entertainment is on point. Food is also great.
author: Juan M.

description: Fun idea. Could use a good dusting/cleaning. Expected something more from the Fairmont this seems more like a dive bar than a fun presidential restaurant.
author: Sheena R.

description:
Ok there are many pro & cons to this joint so let's get started!  First off, I've wanted to come here for many years now and finally got the chance over Mother's Day weekend which also happened to be my Moms 70th Birthday!  So for her surprise dinner I figured this would be a unique place to celebrate.
I was a bit worried seeing as though they don't take reservations (MINUS 1 STAR).  So being a "Holiday weekend" I wasn't sure we would be seated.

The hostesses up front were amazing! They said they would try and push us through as quickly as they could.  (ADD 1 STAR)

We sat at the bar while we waited for a table which was funny because there were MANY tables open.  Since they don't accept reservations, we felt they were just keeping everyone waiting until we hit the 8pm hour when they charge a cover charge....$10 per person.  We had 7 in our party! Wtf?? This is no bueno considering our bar bill cost us over $225 while we waited an hour! (MINUS 1 STAR) The band was good entertainment but only played for under an hour...felt a little cheated on this.

The food was good.  Everyone seem to enjoy their dishes except one person who said their tenderloin was a bit on the tough side.  The portions were decent for the price and they offer gluten free dishes.  So aside from the tough tenderloin I will still give it a star.  (ADD 1 STAR)

In the end, yes we had a good time and my mom enjoyed herself.  It was a memorable venue but because of their no reservation policy (unless you are a hotel guest) and the cover charge, I sadly have to say skip this place.  Drinks were expensive but packed a punch! Staff was really nice!  I just really hate having to give this place such a low score.
author: Liz K.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place out.  We had the Erasure concert down the street at the Masonic and came right when they opened, as they don't take reso.

The Tonga Room is inside The Fairmont. We arrived at 5 pm, when they opened.   There was a line when we arrived.  However, we were seated right away, despite missing 40% of our friends, who were in route.  

We just did drinks/apps but an option to do dinner at 6 pm as an option.  We didn't do entertainment at 8 pm as we had the concert.  I think there is am extra cover charge for this.

Our server was attentive and had great recommendations on drinks.

Since there were 10 of us, we ordered 3 pupu platters to share.  Unfortunately not one item was good.  In fact, it was pretty bad.  Cold, stale, not refresh potstickers, pork tacos, poke tacos, fried shrimp skewers.  There wasn't one thing I liked.

The drinks were better.  I had a mai tai, which is their sogneture drink.  That was nice and refreshing.  They didn't cheese out on the alcohol.

Since the apps were horrendous, we stayed for dinner as we had time.  We didn't need to move tables.

After looking at the menu, I thought, can't go wrong with 28 hr grilled beef short rib.  I was wrong.  It was flavorless, very chewy, and not very good.  The sauce was odd too.  

Honestly, everyone at the table had an issue with their food----flavorless, too salty (fried rice), too salty (king pao), etc.,  The best tasting item was nr friends caulfilower rice dish.  It was actually flavorful.  

Despite all the hype, and knowing the food wasn't going to be good (as many friends have warned), it was a let down.
author: Winnie L.

description:
Thanks to Anthony Bourdain and my enthusiastic husband, we finally made it out to the Tonga Room and honestly?  It was such a delightful experience!  We arrived right at opening and so we snagged a prime table and avoided being part of the SRO.

The atmosphere alone is worth the trip.  If you love a good tiki bar and you *don't* make this trip, what in the world are you waiting for? It's exactly as you'd imagine and MORE!  They converted the swimming pool into an island get-away, hanging onto the water--there's even a little floating bandstand area for live entertainment!  AND IT RAINS INDOORS, a feature that delighted me each and every time (and I'm sure my enthusiasm had nothing to do with the strength of my drinks).

Honestly, is there anything more grand than a tiki drink?  Especially a tiki drink meant for sharing?  Some might consider them a little pricey but you'll definitely get a lot of bang for your buck!  The happy hour menu is delightful--I'm partial to the dumplings (which are whimsically topped with roe!), the ahi toastadas and the calamari!  I probably wouldn't make this my dinner spot, unless you're fine with making it a tapas-like experience but for a first spot?  Divine!

This is *definitely* a place to escape, and a place you'll want to bring out of town relatives.
author: Lorean W.

description: This is such a fun place!!! So entertaining. Drinks are strong here - my hubby was so tipsy.  Food was pretty good. The band, water/rain where all so that it makes it a fun outing out together. Our 11 and 9 year old really were blown away. The said "Like a mini little concert with food". Love the atmosphere.
author: Nancy P.

description: Interesting and fun place! They have (huge) fun-tiki-looking drinks! The bar has a pool in the middle and they usually have live music. Not a place I usually go but its worth the experience :)
author: Daffny V.

description:
My friends and I love tiki themed bars, so we were ecstatic to find this place on Yelp. We arrived about 10 minutes after the doors opened and all of the tables were already taken! No biggie -- we only came for drinks. We made our way to the bar, which was very full as well. Most of us were standing. We were lucky to grab the very end of the bar (no seats), but there were lots of people standing around, in groups, in the VERY small amount of space available between the booths/tables and bar. 
Luckily, the bartenders were very quick to serve each customer. 

We shared a scorpion bowl type of drink called A MONK WALKS INTO A LUAU ($54). It was STRONG -- the type of strong that creeps up on you and hits you out of no where. The serving size looked really small at first, but the alcohol content is high. I prefer fruitier drinks, but if you want a really good buzz, order this one lol. 

The drinks are pretty pricey here, but keep in mind, you are paying for the ambience. There is a floating band that performs during dinner, I believe. It's really pretty inside and they have special effects to make it rain/thunder. If I were to come back, it would specifically be for dinner, for sure.
author: Liana B.

description:
So much fun! This place is legendary with plenty of awesome history behind it (look it up if you're interested!)

The service is warm, the food was good, and the atmosphere was perfect. Highly recommend the macadamia nut crusted mahi mahi, pupu platter and a pina colada to round it all out :)

Be aware there is a cover charge of $10 a person most nights due to the live band.
author: Claudia C.

description:
I came here last Saturday night with my girls for a GNO to have a few drinks and enjoy some music. We got there around 9ish and had to wait in line to get in. Luckily, the line wasn't too bad and only took about 15-20 mins until we got in. Once inside we saw that a live band was playing which was quite exciting! However before we could dance, we had to grab some drinks to get the party going. We ordered:

* mai tais- made sure to tell the bartender to make it strong which it was!! Taste wise though I liked the other drink more

* Tonga kong- this drink was very delicious!! More milky but yummy

Overall the combination of dance floor, drinks, and live dancing makes me wanna go back again!
author: Prasiddha H.

description: This place is great, especially for dates.  Came here and it looked like there was a special event going on, older folks though.  Had some drinks, but it was pricey.  I liked the water giving an island vibe, but it's ok.  There wasn't any live music though.  I wasn't completely impressed, but I'd probably just hang out there date night.
author: KB B.

description:
Been here twice. Drinks, ambiance and the decor are awesome.

Left to go pee, because small bladder, came back and they wouldn't let me in because I didn't have a stamp. Which would have been fine if I'd been given a stamp at the front door originally. 

So I'm standing there not knowing how to get back to my friends. Then bouncer made some snide comment, "you ever been to a pub before" to which I said "yes and I was given a stamp on entry." Called friends, we left, won't be back again. 

It's a big city, you have rules to enforce, that's understandable. Just enforce them fairly and you won't loose customers ‍
author: Claire R.

description: You gotta pay $15 to sit down on a friday night lmao what? the restaurant side was totally empty and everybody buying drinks and enjoying the music had to stand and squish together when there were PLENTY OF SEATS. I mean we're paying for overpriced drinks and they can't even let us sit? bleh
author: Iris W.

description:
This is pregame spot !!!!!!
Ya take your date here and drink up to get ready for the night
author: Victor D.

description:
Some friends and I were on a work trip and stopped by for drinks and maybe dinner... party of 10. The bar was steady, but not busy, yet it took 15 minutes of standing in front of the bar staring politely at the bartender before he asked me if I wanted a drink. After getting drinks and enjoying the indoor rainfall over the indoor pond (complete with lightening!), I asked the hostess about a dinner table for 10-15. She advised there was going to be an hour and a half wait, so we decided to sit in the bar and enjoyed our drinks and waited for the rest of our party to see if everyone wanted to eat here. 

The manager seated us at a bar table and told me we had to at least order appetizers if we were going to stay (because drinks in the bar apparently don't pay the water bill). There was also going to be a cover charge if we stayed for the band. Lots of rules and money to enjoy the nice Hawaiian atmosphere. 

I sat down with my coworkers and my $30 drink, and within 60 seconds had two separate bartenders stop and tell us we couldn't sit there. I should add that I was holding the menu in my hand reading the wildly overpriced menu when they came up to us. I intended to order appetizers for the table, but quickly decided I wasn't giving them any more money.  
 
We quickly drank our drinks and left for better service. If you're looking for overpriced fare and unfriendly service, definitely go to the Tonga.  If you want great service and terrific sushi, go to Maru Sushi just down the hill.
author: J H.

description:
Yummy food, toxic drinks and entertainment galore. You can't beat the environment in this place. 

We have the sampler appetizer and loved the options that provided. I ordered the mani mahi and I'd recommend that if you like mahi mahi. 

The rain maker drink was strong. We hoped they would light it on fire but they don't do that anymore. Still a great experience and drink to share. 

The garlic asparagus side dish was flavorful and worth ordering again!
author: Jarrett R.

description:
Had such a great time here with a group of friends! Live music, rain, lightening and thunder every 20 mins in the evenings. The band floats around rocking a boat to their tunes from the 70s, 80s and I think 90s was in there too! The band is fun and very entertaining! They get folks moving on the dance floor that is located in the front of the bar area. 

Located inside the fabulous Fairmont Hotel! From the lobby elevators, press T for TONGA! RAWR!!!! That will take you downstairs to the Tonga Room level.

We sat along the water and enjoyed the monsoons with thunder and lightening, it was great! We had a bunch of small plates that were very filling. We had the scallop salad, potstickers, fried crab claws and bbq ribs--all great! Topped the evening off with the Rum cake with toasted marshmallow, yikes it was good! The drinks are generous and strong, too!

Stop in for a treat sometime it's super fun for first dates or groups, birthday parties!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
A nice place to impress someone or be on a date but only if you don't mind the loud hawaiian music in the background. The decor is hawaiian themed as well as the drinks and food. This place has a nice ambience to it and the food is alright too. 

I tried the porterhouse steak which is 45 bucks as you would expect in such an expensive place but it wasn't nearly worth the bucks. Instead try the appetizer sample plate which includes some ribs, vegetable rolls , fried crab claws, wings, and my favorite of all the tuna poke. We also tried the rum cake which was as good as anyone would make at home by watching an episode of a baking show.

The drinks were good especially their Mai Tai is pretty amazing.

What I didnt like was the really loud music and  the service which was terrible at first. The server was kind of rude at first but was fine later. They charge 10 bucks per person for music which doesnt seem right.

Overall this place is worth going once but be prepared to spend 100 bucks per person for mediocre food and drinks.
author: Sanjeev K.

description:
My fiance and I decided to treat ourselves in our last few nights in SF before moving... so we stayed at the Fairmont and went on over to the Tonga Room for dinner and drinks. It's pretty much a rite of passage to visit the Tonga Room while in SF!

Food is subpar and expensive. Drinks were good, but also pricy.

To sum up: a dent in the wallet... worthwhile for the experience though to watch live music and water/rain show
author: Janet H.

description:
They charge a $10 dollar cover during live performances, though our waiter didn't add it on. 

Drinks are a bit pricey but they are strong, very delicious. 

We ordered the pupu platter, crab cake, steak, and the fish with asparagus, ube cream, and an on the house birthday dessert which was some type of mousse (it was delicious). The waiter "Alex" (who happened to be Chinese) noticed we were also Chinese, and offered to sing happy birthday in Chinese since we were celebrating that night. He provided exceptional service throughout the evening. 

Overall, I would recommend coming for the drinks, hanging out for the live music. The food was nothing special. Most who were here that night seemed to be tourist who probably saw the restaurant listed somewhere about the must visit bars/restaurants in the city.
author: Long C.

description:
Everything is super expensive, but what do you expect? You're in a freaking pool tiki bar underneath a fancy hotel! 

Drinks are awesome (beware the hangovers from sugary drinks!!) and food is delicious! THE CHICKEN WINGS ARE EXCELLENT!

The band is AWESOME!

This whole place is just ridiculous and amazing! Have fun, let loose, dance at your tables, stick an umbrella in your hair, and just enjoy yourself!
author: Nora E.

description: A bit of a tourist trap...fun for a group outing, but will not be back. Went for a girl friend's 30th and was shocked at how crowded it was on a Saturday night. I actually lost my voice the next day from having to talk so loud. If your goal is to spend a lot of money on mediocre drinks ($45 for 3 tequila shots) and get that raspy sounding voice, definitely check it out. Otherwise, I would look elsewhere for a night out.
author: Megan C.

description:
Hospitality 10/10
Drinks 10/10
Food 4/10 
Food was cold and clearly under heat lamps. I guess that's hotel food tho. I suggest going for drinks and music. Skip food
author: Sarah L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a long time, so I was glad that I finally got the opportunity. 

Their drinks are tasty and have just the right amount of liquor. 

Kinda sucked that they couldn't make me a blended drink, but I just drowned my sorrows into another daiquiri. 

We asked the hostess if there was any possible chance for a table and her "unfortunately that's not how it works" line absolutely rubbed me the wrong way. 

I get it. It's busy. No need for the Kevin Hart "the way my account is set up" attitude. 

Can only attest for the drinks, but I'll be back to try the food. You hear that hostess?!
author: Rosa P.

description:
Bad bad bad.
I'm not willing to give any star.
Bad service and tried to scam us for more money.
I had my 40th bday on Wednesday October 3rd. For 16 ppl. Reserved at 7:30pm. We didn't get a table till 7:50pm. I knew the contact said we need to leave at 9:30pm. BUT we got to the table and our appetizers came almost 8pm. Also we talked to the managers before hand about extended time  charge before I signed the contract that the server can come talk to us and let us know when they need the table or close our bill because we don't want to pay for extended time charge. Who wants to pay $250/hour!!. No one came to us. I walked to the server to check on our bill. He gave me the bill over time charge $250!! +$50 for set up fee that they exploded my #4bolloon and they couldn't do any about it. Too bad because i celebrated for my #40th bday.
All in all.. this place is not a good place for a big party over 10ppl. They tried to rip u off and tried to get your money if you stay longer than 2 hours. The point no one or any server came and let us know when we were there almost 2 hours. A good server should let us know and communicate with us about the time. 
The manager/Alexis who we talked before we signed the contract twisted her words. She said no worry I'll be on the night shift. If not busy I 'll let you guys stay at the table without charging or we can ask you to move and find a table for you at the bar area." We were surprised that she was reluctant to work with us. 

The server/Nolle or Colle was bad, not friendly. Another server/Bash was nice. He wasn't our server, but he was willing to take care of us.

This place is good only nice decor and good music. 

I'm very very disappointed.!!!!!

I won't come back here again for a big party. Or make sure all details written down on the contract, not some verbal agreement with managers. 

A bartender/George was very nice and made a great drinks for us while we were waiting for our table to be ready. 

The manager/Alexis was not professional. She twisted her words. She didn't know what she 's doing in hospitality business. 

I hope senior managers read this message and do something about this before more clients get upset about the same issue. 

I always come to Fairmont hotel on my occasions. This time was very very disappointed.
author: Sorayatorn E.

description: Over-rated. I don't understand why the line wraps around to get into this place. Drinks are over priced, food is okay. Nothing spectacular. The appetizer sampler was best part. The band playing on the water never left the back end of the water so we couldn't really see them, but the songs were fun classics. It's fun for kids. There was a kid party there when we went... at night.
author: Ro R.

description: Love! Love it!!! I loved the boat in the pool. The music was great! The drink was amazing. I dont remember what it was called but it coconut Im it. It was Delicious, wish there was more room to dance but hey it San Francisco. Either I'll be coming back to visit in the future
author: Adriana R.

description:
Pros
Live band
Whimsical environment 
Strong drinks

Cons
Stiff drinks come with a price tag to match
Need to make reservation or wait times are easily north of +1-2hrs
Very little room to stand comfortably or sit for that matter

Overall Thoughts

I'm glad I went but the wait time and cost makes it harder for repeat future visits especially for larger parties
author: Eddie W.

description: TRAP. Came during happy hour thinking it'd be something fun to check out and was basically like walking into a dirty version of Disney's Animal Kingdom. Happy hour drinks are an alarming $10 for what is basically pre-made grossness. After 10 minutes of unsticking our shoes from the carpet by the bar, my boyfriend and I decided to leave our full drinks and go elsewhere.
author: Cara S.

description: I like this place to hang out, Very good vibe, Good food and feel's like i'm in one of Hawaii's Bar. order few drink & Platter, seat back relax & enjoy the music. Oh wait for the thunderstorm indoor lol!
author: DanGel P.

description:
This is such a cool place hidden away in the lower level of a historic hotel.  The hotel lobby is fantastic so much check it out on your way in or out.  It's beautiful !!! 

When I looked it up I was very confused by its location because it has an indoor pool !! But it has much more ...It has an indoor pool and a floating island on which a band sings live tunes. They have a waterfall and hurricane theme with lightening to make the experience more memorable. The drinks are tiki bar themed and the place has a great interior. 
We got the mai tai and the beers here and they were great ! Did not try the food but did some dancing to compensate ! 

Note : If you wish to reserve a table call ahead ( about 2 weeks on average ) I was told. Call ahead because they might be staring a only walk in policy sometime soon too! 

Will recommend this place for sure !
author: Shivani B.

description:
Hubs and I came and it was great! I think the main difference that'll make or break your experience is where you're seated which depends on when you get there. On a Saturday evening we got there by 4:25ish and there were no other people waiting. We were the first so we sat down by the waiting area and within 4:45-5pm the calls were nonstop and about 40 people lined up. They take dinner reservations but their lounge is first come first serve so your only way is to get there early. I've seen people wait around the super busy, full bar, stand around, etc which I'm sure is a damper on their experience.

I overheard that for dinner reservations they're booked at least one month in advance so take that into consideration. We were the first ones seated so we scored a really cool seat in the lounge next to the open seat area by the pool. Every 15 minutes or so they stimulate lightning, thunder and rain by the pool which was cool. 

We got two Mai Tais in a bowl which was very good and we also ended up getting a spice killer too. Drinks are CRAZY strong (I choked on both my first sips) so let the ice melt and water it down a little. The ambiance is super cool, though inconsistent. I saw some Japanese room dividers, pirate flag, islander wooden deco, east asian lighting, a buddha sculpture, tiki huts, Hawaiian mahalos, etc. I think this place is a must stop at least once, it's located inside the Fairmont Hotel and also have live music at 8pm. There is a $10-15 cover once the music starts though that is waived for hotel guests.
author: Amy K.

description: Too touristy for my liking. Honestly a little corny, with the rain and the decor. It sort of reminded me of a rainforest cafe. My cocktail, the adult swim, was so acidic, it burnt the back of my throat and and couldn't finish it. Probably wouldn't take a date there, but if you're planning on entertaining families with children, this place could work.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Want to grab a drink with a friend on a Saturday night?! Come here!!! This place has got an amazing setting with an indoor pool and a live band playing great music to dance to (Brown Eyed Girl, My Girl, classics, etc)! 

It gets pretty busy and there can be a wait for tables if you want to sit down, but if you do sit down, you'll have to pay cover for the live entertainment/band ($15 tonight for the Island Groove but can vary)! 

If you order drinks at the bar and stand, you don't have to pay any cover but can enjoy the music and even bust a couple of dance moves so I highly recommend it! :) 

In terms of drink orders, my friends got Mai Tais ($15) and I got a Fog Cutter ($17)! Both were good though the Mai Tai was stronger while I found the Fog Cutter to be lighter - but it's still quite a big drink so it'll hit you fast if you have a low tolerance, heads up! 

Will be back again soon!
author: Kristie M.

description:
I have such a love/hate relationship with the Tonga Room. On the one hand, the live band, rain shower, and general vibe are pure tiki magic. One the other, the drinks are...just not very good, and so expensive. I went with a big group and got to try a variety of drinks as well as the bowls. This is rarely the case but the bowls were far superior to all of the drinks, besides the Jungle Bird, and the Jet Pilot which are both fine. Not great, but fine. The Zombie is basically undrinkable, because it tastes so overwhelmingly of absinthe. Stay away. 

The snacks are totally passable pupu platter fare, crunchy spring rolls and yummy dipping sauces. The fried crab claws sound like a good idea but they're not, really. Crab is better left un-fried. 

Basically? Come for the dancefloor, but maybe stick to beer unless you're ok emptying your wallet for a headache.
author: Maud D.

description:
"On a perfect day,... I know that I can count on you.

When that's not possible,...Tell me can you weather the storm?

'Cause, I neeeeed some-bAAAAh-dey who will stand by meeee.

Through the gooOOOd times, and bAAAd times - 
She will alwAAAys, ...always be right there...

SuNNy dayz, .....eVvvRi'body loves them - Tell me baby CAN YOU STAND THE RAIN?

Storms will come....

This we know for sure (This we know for sure)

CAN YOU STAND THE RAIN???"
________________________

This "New Edition" classic needs NO introduction (but I'm gone introduce it anyway, for sake of this review).
