While it may very well be sunny wherever you're​ viewing this review from, 9x out of 10, it won't be in San Francisco, and while I should just as easily be struck by lightning for neglecting to review my FAVORITE place in the good ole' City By The Bay, it's FRIDAYYYYYYY​ --- and this is the perfect day for a ray of sunshine to better place a much overdue end to this thunderous world wind of a week.

Can I get an "Amen?"

Alright nah'.

While I'm at it, let me get another "Amen" if you ain't doing sh## today and couldn't care less who knows it! 

Haha. Yazzz! 

Anyone that knows me, knows that Kenny Ken is a sucker for 2 things.

Booze and ambiance. 

Occasionally I'm willing to alternate the order, but one Mai tai, made "the RIGHT way" and it's time tuh' get faded and X-rated!

{... insert twerk gif here...}

Sidebar: Come to think of it, maybe that's why I've been called upon to perform naked karaoke so many darned times. Ohhhh, those Yelp Elite Events, I tell ya.

Wait. What's that you say???! 

That's not a REAL game? What da hell?! Come on Yelp! 

I knew something fishy was going on when I exceeded this month's stalker/troll capacity a few days early. 

Drunken stupor aside, my first encounter with San Fran's "Tonga Room" was many.... many, ...many moons ago. While on a road trip up from LA with some of my USC college buds, one's friend, a local to The City persuaded us all to stop off here refusing to reveal the surprise.

We were famished but he didn't let us down. Mind you, that was a good 20 years ago (yes, dammit - I'm that old), it amazes me how GREAT experiences NEVER seem to escape one's mental Rolodex and how upon visiting years later, a superbly mirrored session just adds on to the overall perception. 

Need I expound on how years afterwards I've visited this town on "grips" of occasions for one reason or the next and with continued adulation, the word on this place must've gotten out and jeez --- it's more impossible to get into this place than a Catholic Confession after Mardi Gras!

(That was a San Francisco "Sister Act" reference in case you didn't catch on)

Located in, of all places - THE BASEMENT - &/or accessible by way of a private entrance within the Historic Fairmont Hotel, this lounge, bar, club,... brothel (your pick) packs quite the infusion of history. 

Sadly I'm hungover this morning and you'll have to go elsewhere to obtain that lesson.

With a cover charge of $7-10.00 (dependent the day of week), the lounge's specialty is "Asian persuasion" and damned if they ain't all that and ...."dim sum"! 

The aura is tropically chill at best.

We're talking flames, flicker and all kinds of flare and as if the live band wasn't enough, there's a category 3 thunderstorm .... INSIDE, transpiring every 15-20 minutes or so during your meal!!!

(And I thought -I- brought the BOOOOM!)

From drizzle to drips followed by a solid downpour, the precipitation is prominent and chiLLLe... it hardly ends there; Kenny wouldn't steer you wrong, so TRUST ME when I say that the drinks here are to DIE FOR! 

From coma to resurrection - THE HURRICANE, as indicated within the establishment's name alone - is deservingly their signature drink while they take pride in their house made Mai tai and bay-beh- 

*** IT AIN'T NO SECRET THAT THIS KATRINA THEMED ELIXIR WILL FLOOD YOUR LIFE WITH ALL KINDS OF MISERY AND LEAVE YOU DELUSIONAL, IN SHAMBLES AND IN ABSOLUTE DESPAIR!!!

From there, there's a buffet, regular menu, "Happy Hour" and the list goes on and while most are overpriced and non-revolutionary, is it not prominent that you're paying for the EXPERIENCE of your being enabled up undergo it all?!

[---Disclaimer: It's best I interject that just as the fools that are dying to get into Heaven will surely have to wait their turns...  those looking to dine within it's 2nd coming have got to do the same.---]

Tables within this joint are often booked for weeks, if not MONTHS at a time, and while "Open Table" is an option, anticipating this place answering the phone, IS NOT!

"Mama always said not to use the phone when it rained. Just sit back hunny... Let the good Lawd' do His work...."

In summary and/or in the event it's not perfectly obvious - I love this place! Yes it's pricey and plausibly even somewhat cheesy. Whatev'z -

Luv Luv Luv...

With that into consideration, my question to those reading is simple, "can YOU stand the rain"?
author: Kenny G.

description:
Tips (for a Saturday night):
- The bar area opens at 5 PM. The main dining room opens at 6 PM.
- There is a $15 cover charge beginning at 8 PM when the live music starts.
- The drinks are quite pricey starting at $14+, but you do get your money's worth in alcohol.

My boyfriend and I came for dinner on a Saturday night and waited an hour for a table in the main dining room. Our server was super attentive and recommended drinks and entrees for our first visit. We ended up ordering the calamari and short rib to share, which was enough for the two of us.

MY LAWD, the drinks were strong! I chose the Hurry Kane while my boyfriend ordered the 1934 Zombie. He usually has pretty high tolerance, but even he couldn't finish his drink and I barely made a dent in mine before I had to stop.

I recommend this restaurant to SF visitors in search of a unique experience. However, be prepared to spend a pretty penny!
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Way cool!!

Food was great as was the service and atmosphere. 

Highly recommend and will be back.
author: Gina C.

description: No notice until we got there. Closed to a private party for the whole night. Turned away.
author: Hoang V.

description: I can't believe I haven't given this place a review yet, we've been so many times now. First and foremost -being inside of a hotel is sort of obnoxious because you have to walk all the way through the hotel to get to it, but I guess it's good business for them. We can usually find parking on the street which is a plus in San Francisco, but you still have a good little walk ahead of you to get there. Another irritating factor is they don't open until 4 o'clock I believe, and while I realize a lot of fancier places open on the later side, it's a bummer if you're a day drinker. I was so intrigued to pay a visit because Anthony Bourdain had been there and made it look so exotic and amazing, but unfortunately when you walk in it's incredibly dark and always super crowded. The drinks were good, but not amazing. It's definitely a cool place to visit if you want The tiki bar experience or to at least say that you've been, I really only go back because the husband seems to really enjoy the atmosphere. Drinks in my opinion are way overpriced but they do have that Hawaiian style theme with the fresh fruit and the cool glasses and stuff so I can see the appeal. Just one more interesting little venue to visit in the city.
author: Prescila B.

description:
The service was great. The location of the restaurant is inside a huge hotel. Easy place to park outside. 
It is 10$ after 8pm because of the band music. 
And you can choose to have a table at the bar or a table for dinner. 
The cocktail for 4 was huge and and pretty good. 
And the starter was also delicious. 
But the restaurant is really expensive.. perfect for a date.
author: Naj A.

description:
There were so many awesome moments here from the killer pork dish to my fantastic drink but I have to say that every interaction I had with the hostess's from trying to make reservations the day before to being there in person were super disappointing. They were so rude it just diminished the overall experience. 
Make sure the people that start off a diner's experience set the tone you want.
author: Alishia S.

description:
They have a nice calm environment. They dont have too much food options but it was descent. We ordered the wings and fried rice with no meat and it turned out better than expected. 

The live music is on point and the dance floor does not get ratchet. Its a good place to go on a date night!
author: Gagan K.

description: Great atmosphere and the pool is so cool. Happy hour is $10. The appetizers are great. The full meals are pricy.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Not good.  Don't waste your time or money. 

We were initially excited to indulge a few umbrella drinks at this unexpected tropical oasis beneath the historical and grand Fairmont hotel. The Tonga Room has its own side entrance separate from the main hotel . We found our way to the dark hideaway and was greeted by a ho hum hostess who asked if we wanted to stand in the middle of the small bar area or sit at a table in the lounge area ...uhmmmm yeah , considering there were many open seats , please give us a table with a couple of chairs to enjoy our drinks for a moment !  Gheez, it was totally awkward and weird . 


Anyway, our server was actually much better . She gave us a couple of drink and food menus , 
 and wow... everything was seriously over priced. Every drink was priced at $15 or above. Nothing special about the drinks . The server informed us that they are famous for their mai tai, so we ordered one along with a simple piña colada . The $15 dollar mai tai tasted the same as a 5$ mai tai from any dive bar in the city. It tasted like a regular mai tai, nothing mysterious or special about it . My piña colada  had too much ice and tasted sour with an off-putting medicinal after taste. I did not enjoy it at all.   What a waste of $$. 

Only saving grace to the Tonga Room was the over the top tropical tiki decor. It was kind of cool to be sitting in a dim room lit with tiki lamps, decorated with huts and bamboo tables and chairs surrounding a huge shallow lagoon that receives thunderstorms every 15 minutes ! I mean it's kind of cheesy, but still fun . You can't help but smile and enjoy your surroundings, even if the drinks were poo poo . 

Would I come back again ? No. It was an experience .  I'm over it now .
author: Brenda B.

description:
I love the décor, atmosphere, vibe and live band. The place is a fun spot and you feel transported to the Hawaiian islands. 

The band absolutely makes this place. I especially love the drummer. They all look as though they are having fun on their boat stage in the water. They play songs from all the decades. 

They also have a dance floor and people seem to just stand up and dance any where. 

Now as far as service. They are busy and they don't seem to have enough help. But they are super friendly. 

The food is ok. But appears people come here more for their fun drinks and fun atmosphere.
author: Angelina E.

description: Oh Dear.... I've been here twice... although I think the staff should be friendlier the drinks are so good that I overlook some things. These drinks are seriously good! I felt like I was back in Hawaii. Dinner was great too. Really good tuna poke.
author: Glorimar A.

description: Fun, quirky, interesting crowd for people watching, great band, ok food - we would do it again. You definitely need reservations. The line to get in without one is an hour long.
author: Nat R.

description: I dont know if I would return here on a weekend. It was crowded AF on a Saturday night and the drinks were too overpriced for the ambiance (raucous crowds, loud music, limited seating). I might instead go to a dive bar or a club for the same. The rain did pour every half hr but I really don't think it is a worth a $20+ drink.
author: Shalini C.

description: It was ok. A nice touristy spot. The food was good. The music was good. The drinks they were ok.
author: Jae N.

description:
Had the most fun time a Tonga Room. The only reason I'm giving 4/5 is because of the wait to be seated.

We arrived at 6:30 and were told the wait was 30 minutes, that's reasonable. Then while we waited we watched all these other groups of twos threes and fours be seated before us, it was irritating.

However, our waiter was so sweet and accommodating. The drinks were fruity and strong! We added rum floaters($6 rum shot) to our last round and really enjoyed it!

The salt and pepper pork was tender. Our Short Rob was tasty! A member of our group HATES onions, our waiter was very conscientious of her tastes and went above and beyond to make sure she was comfortable.

I will definitely be back!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Came back again for a birthday dinner and honestly I think it's probably the one & only time I'll be eating here again. The only dish that was pretty good was the appetizer of tuna poke with ube chips. We also had the scallops and Mongolian beef, which were just "okay". The beef dish has way too much sauce and the scallops did not have enough flavor. Both came with a side of steamed rice which in my option was over cooked.
The drinks are good, although extremely pricey! The band starts at 8pm, since we had a dinner reservation we didn't have to pay the $10 fee to get in after 8pm.
author: Nicole A.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend while visiting San Francisco, and we really enjoyed it! 

Drinks:
The drinks are pricey, but they're really good. The Tonga Kong was my favorite drink of the night! Sooo good. First I ordered the zombie, which was the strongest one we had. My boyfriend got the jet pilot, which was pretty good, but after one of us got the Tonga Kong we decided it was the best and kept ordering that one for the rest of the night. 

Atmosphere:
Get a table, it's worth it. We paid $15 each for a table, and it made the night so much better. We could leave the table and go dance and come back, and we had perfect view of the band, as well as somewhere to keep our stuff. I loved that the band was in a little boat in a pool. The "rain" and "lightning" was cool and really added to the mood.
author: Christine G.

description: A majestic and historic restaurant. A classic unique decor. The food was surprisingly tasty for being such a touristy place.
author: T T.

description:
Terrible service and overpriced drinks. Would definitely recommend spending your money at any other bar in SF. I will never give this establishment my business again.

The place was empty and they were holding the door with about 30+ people in line. The hostess and door guy were incredibly rude and would not let 2 of our friends in to join our group that was celebrating a birthday even though we had already been there two hours spending $20 per drink.

Ended up going to Tunnel Top which had excellent service, cocktails, music, and they didn't charge us $15 per person to sit down like the Tonga Room.
author: Sami L.

description: For the most part you were paying for the atmosphere and the experience. There is a nice band where they played in the middle of the night which was fun. Food wise, it is mediocre. The dessert also was very mediocre and dry.
author: Coco V.

description:
I was worried this would be an overpriced tourist trap. While it is overpriced and a tourist trap, it still exceeded my expectations.  Had to make reservations a month in advance, so if you're thinking of trying this place out, be prepared to wait a bit. 

The drinks while being really expensive, are actually lather large and strong. I had the zombie drink and had it on a empty stomach. Bad idea. However, the drink itself? Fantastic. Food portions are also much larger than I would have imagined.  You also get a band experience around 8, so stick around if you can. 

Had a good time here and would easily try it again at some point in the future.
author: Benny H.

description:
Ahhh this place was fantastic! So much music and dancing made for a lively dinner!

Okay so obviously there's a ginormous pool in the middle. Surprise,surprise! The real kicker comes when the floating band sets out for their performances at random times throughout your dinner. There also appeared to be a bar and dancing area though so if you're just here for the live band, it seems like a great place to dance and mingle with friends.

The food was pretty good! We ordered family style so I got to try a lot of different things - Ahi Poke Tuna Tostada was BOMB! I loved the combo of the Ahi Poke Tuna and crispness of the chip it was served on. Really good flavor as well! I could not stop eating the lemon chicken, it was soooo good! The sauce was not too sweet nor sour, perfect taste all around!

They have the BEST drinks too. 1934 Zombie if you want to be a 1934 Zombie LOL! Seriously though, this one is trouble because it tasted delicious but was ridiculously strong! 

If I'm back in the area I will absolutely visit again... I had such a blast enjoying drinks and dinner while getting to watch a live floating band!
author: Staci M.

description:
Went on a Saturday night. Absolutely packed, noisy and there was a cover charge. AND TOTALLY WORTH IT. 

We had a blast! The drinks are strong, the live band was on point, the waitstaff were pleasant and the food was so good. 

The inside ambiance and scenery are unreal. Too neat to not go see!
author: Cacha D.

description:
The food here surprises me every time we take visiting friends since it's pretty pricey for your average date with a wife who has been many times. If I was single trying to impress someone this is as good as any in service, food, ambiance, and drinks.

You are paying for all of that and I recommend telling the back story which is part of the appeal.

No true SF tour is complete without a double play of sunset at top of the mark followed by dinner at Tonga room. 

Reservations are tough to come by but when an earlier one opened up, 7 pm instead of our 9:15 they did call me and offer to change it which I find incredibly unexpected yet awesome.
author: David A.

description:
The band and the decor/experience here are excellent---it is a great place to grab a drink and sit and watch the band. However, the overall experience is hampered by (1) an extremely high (and inconsistent) cover charge, (2) barely any sitting area in the bar, and (3) extremely pricey drinks given their quality. 
I would primarily recommend this place if you already happen to be in the area; while the atmosphere is wonderful, I cannot imagine spending an entire evening here, and (regrettably) there are not a lot of other places nearby.
author: John C.

description: Dude I got jacked up on a Zombie. Ok seriously this is a cool tiki bar themed lounge that serves up great cocktails. Yes I did have the Zombie and it was excellent the staff is very busy although makes time to greet each guest and provides drinks quickly.
author: Manny G.

description: Went here with a couple of friends after a late dinner and it's a great spot! The vibe and decorations were super cool and the pool in the middle of the bar was an awesome touch. The cocktails are also really good (and strong), even though they are quite expensive (almost twice the price of a regular cocktail). I ordered the 1934 Zombie, which was the strongest and sweetest cocktail on the menu, and it definitely delivered. The only issue with this place is that there is not much standing space and you have to pay to sit down, which means it does get very crowded on the dance area. Overall, however, a pretty cool and well themed place.
author: Sampath D.

description:
Well our first visit here on a weekday was amazing. Good service.. live music.. Good drinks. Atmosphere was fun 

It was so impressive that we returned on our last night in San Francisco 

However the second visit left a lot to be desired. There was a lineup and yet half the room was empty

We finally got a bar table after waiting for a while at the crowded bar

The waitress had 4 tables to look after but seemed aloof. My wife asked her if she could take a picture. Her response was she was busy and would do it later 

We ordered the wings.. which were  covered in sticky sauce and quite expensive for the portion. I had  few beers but was put off by the attitude we were experiencing

Our server vanished and after a while we had to flag down a different server to ask for the bill

Then our server returned and asked if we still wanted our picture taken. Sure why not.. after more than an hour

Anyway it was really disappointing to receive such service..at a Fairmont none the less..especially after having such a good time the previous visit

I'd still recommend a visit.. but not on the weekends
author: Timmy T.

description: Rarely ok probably never have I rated anything five stars. This place is the shizzle!!!! Fabulous cocktails and the food was great. Our waitress PH was exactly what a waitress should be! When your in San Fran seek this place out!
author: Alicia S.

description:
We came here for 1 drink, just to try it out and see what all the fuss was about, after all, I am half Tongan. I had to laugh that the food category was "Asian fusion". 

We realised that there was a cover charge after 8pm on saturdays so we came about 5pm when they opened - there was already a line and a 1 hour wait for a table!! Or if you were happy to stand then you could go straight in. 

We got a cocktail each. I got a mahi tai and he got a tonga Kong. They were both pretty good, very expensive and the guy behind the bar was a bit grumpy. Also interesting that they were pre-made and just poured. 

Nothing Tongan about the place what so ever, but it was a bit of fun with the rain shower, floating stage and thunder sounds.
author: Rowena B.

description:
Dragged to this place at the Fairmont hotel because Antony Bourdain came here. I am always suspicious of places with a celebrity tag on it. They never say the place was bad but only hypes it. It is akin to seeing things with rose tinted glasses. 

The decor was cheap and kitschy. It was a very pale shadow of Disneyland's Tiki room. They converted a swimming pool into a pond with a raft on it. It was a similar concept to Studio 54 where they converted a dingy basement into an exclusive celebrity hangout. The food and drinks are just ok for a very inflated price. A drink and 2 desserts was $50. Been here, done that.
author: Keo N.

description:
Tonga room is located in the lovely Faremont hotel which is where the Obamas hang out when in SF. All the more reason to check this place out :)

Go on a weekday and you can avoid waiting in line for an hour. We got seated in a cute cabana to enjoy the evening with great food, drinks, thunder storm and live music.

Polynesian-themed decor with palm trees and cute little tiki huts, crew cruising around in their Hawaiian shirts, happy people dancing away to nice music, Vibe is just contagious. Food ($$$) and drinks (whoa are they Strong or What?) are great, you can't expect any less in a restaurant of This calibre.

What makes this place stand out is the experience. A live band is entertaining us. From a floating boat, thats floating in the middle of the pool, which is in the middle of the room... Crraaazy as it sounds, whats even crazier is the Artificial thunder storm show.

Light rain, lightening which is followed by thunder, then the downpour which slows down to a drizzle, it all stops with water dripping from the cabanas, and before you know its raining like cats n dogs again...How Awesome is Thaaat?!! I laaaaved it!

Lost a point only because food could be better.

If you wanna get a little tipsy on just a couple of drinks and have a good time with good crowd, check this place out. You wont be disappointed.

Highly recommended!
author: Sujeesha V.

description:
OMG, SO MUCH OLD SCHOOL, OLD COOL FUN ...

It's important to understand the background of the Tonga Room - this was the indoor pool of the Fairmont Hotel from 1906 - 1945.  The Fairmont Hotel sits atop Nob Hill, and is a gem.  In 1945 the hotel converted its indoor pool area into the Polynesian-themed Tonga Room, and it's been a legend in San Francisco ever since.

So let's be honest - any bar with 70+ years of staying power must be doing something right.

Drinks are STRONG.  The food was all good.  If you go early, there's a happy hour that is a bargain (both drinks and food).

IMPORTANT - they no longer accept or require reservations, so tables are first-come, first served.  That's a good thing ...

This is a really fun, cool experience.  We left full, tipsy, and laughing.  Loved it.  Will return, hopefully soon.
author: Fred B.

description: We visited The Tonga Room after finding it on a list for the Best restaurants in San Francisco. We were seated within 30 minutes, and were greeted by our amazing server, Tina, immediately. She had our cocktails and apps ordered in no time. I'm a wing connoisseur, and these wings were amazing. Half-way through dinner, the band started to play, but we were slightly out of sight...so we asked Tina if we could move to a closer table. She happily agreed and we got the BEST VIEW (no lie) of the band. We ended our meal and Tina recommended some key places we should hit before we headed back to OC. Overall, great experience, thanks to Tina!
author: Maddie S.

description: Fantastic but super expensive drinks. It's ridiculous that with the prices of drinks and their mediocre food, they still have the nerve to charge guests 15.00 each if there happens to be a band playing at the time when you are dining.
author: Chris R.

description:
This is not about the food because we didn't eat here. We had a bit of time to kill before going home so we popped in for drinks.

There was a band playing stuff and I seriously lost it when they started playing a Bee Gees song. I LOVE the Bee Gees! We danced until a bunch of other people on the dance floor busted out in some coordinated Zumba routine. Then the rain storm started and then we smooched and called it a night. 

If you like indoor pools that aren't meant for swimming, drinking with people in town for conferences who might spontaneously bust out in Zumba moves on the dance floor, and indoor rain storms, then this may very well be the place for you.
author: Loli L.

description: My husband and I went to the tonga room last Saturday.  The food was delicious and a very fun atmosphere.  It's located in the fairmont hotel and they converted the indoor pool into a little Caribbean oasis.  What added to the ambiance was a live band playing in a little boat on the water.  We ordered the vegetable pot stickers, mahi mahi  and rum cake.   Food and drinks are pricey but all in all, a great restaurant.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Anyone watched the Anthony Bordain show: The Layover (featured on the Travel Channel)? The one where AB shares the girly drink bowl with those long straws and orders a few more? This is the place for a really hard core concoction. No lie! The Mai Tai $15 was just that! It was so strong we had to ask the waiter for something sweet to soothe the rums and mix down. The server was gracious and brought some pineapple juice and even that was still strong. These drinks are really great for someone who doesn't like weak water downed drinks. Tonga gives you the whole shabang! 

Tip: if you want to dine here you better call a few weeks ahead for weekend reservations. Otherwise the weekdays are a lot more easier to reserve. 
This is located inside of the beautifully adorned Fairmont hotel where the inside of Tonga beholds the original pool which now is used for the live bands performing on a boat and thunder and rain effects pop in every now and then. The set up is as if you're on the ship and tiki decorations everywhere. The talented band was loved by the crowd. Tonga is a great place for large groups as well as for couples.
author: Tzarina W.

description: Loved it here.  We went here back 2013 for Valentine's dinner so idk if anything changed. A little expensive but we had a really nice time. Came here with a bunch of friends and it's nice for groups. We had 10 people in our group and our bill was at $730 plus tip. We weren't too hung up on the amount since we did come with people who loves to drink and knew that the food is pricey ahead of time. But definitely a good experience.
author: lala d.

description: Known for "its tropical décor, decadent libations and Polynesian-fusion cuisine since 1945," I came here with the expectations of overpaying for drinks and appetizers and being surrounded with cheesy tiki decor and those expectations were met. It was worth it once, just to say "oh yeah, I've been there" and my partner and I really did have fun because of the strong drinks and the tasty appetizers (and mostly because he makes me laugh.) But we won't be coming back because the prices are REALLY high for what you get. The appetizer dishes came with just 4 pieces each. They might want to consider throwing in another piece to make it 5 pieces total so that customers can't readily calculate how much they really paid for one piece ($4 per dumpling?!?! $4 per spring roll?!?) That or make the drinks even stronger so that their math skills will be almost nonexistent. Came for the novelty of it all, we enjoyed ourselves, but definitely just a one time thing.
author: Mae D.

description:
Recommended to me by many locals, Tonga Room did not deliver. I came on a Friday at 6 and the place was packed with guffawing tourists and corporate types having their awkward "work happy hour." The bartender was nice enough, clearly overworked, but the drinks were all premade and dumped from a bottle.

There is a very large "lagoon" (more of a "pool") in the center of the place, and apparently a band floats around on a large raft and plays music in this thing: Unfortunately, at least while I was there, the lagoon was crowded entirely with people taking selfies and staring at their phones, and there was bland pop music playing from the speakers. While I mulled whether to stay and wait for the band, someone farted out the most offensive cloud of stink i've ever encountered, making my decision very easy.

I had very high hopes for a historic tiki bar in san francisco, but...just no. They get one more star than nothing because their bartender seemed to understand my plight despite no exchange of words.
author: joe s.

description:
Finally! The infamous Tonga Room, located within the historic Fairmont Hotel. I've done a few events here and passed by but never had the chance to make reservations and actually dine at the Tonga Room. Fortunately I have an awesome boss that reads my mind and made Friday night dinner reservations.

Some of us arrived early and were able to get seated. The hostesses and waiters were super friendly and accommodating. We got to sit at one of the tables next to the water, which had a stunning view! Lots of twinkly lights and cute cabanas. Once in awhile, the "show" would happen, where thunder, lightning, and rain is simulated. Interesting... And kinda random. This room probably used to be an indoor pool at the hotel. This is so much better.

While we waited for everyone to arrive, we ordered the "Monk Walks into a Luau" cocktail bowl for everyone to share. Lots of fun tropical flavors that will give you a sugar rush AND a hangover in the morning. We also ordered the Royal Pupu Platter. Best decision for a big group! Everything on the platter was solid: the BBQ Kona pork ribs, shiitake mushrooms spring rolls, spicy chicken wings, and Dungeness crab rangoons. Sooo good.

For my entrée, I got the kalua pork, which is smoked and slow roasted and topped with island slaw, pork au jus, and Hawaiian rolls. Mmmm... Would HIGHLY recommend this dish. It's a TON of food, enough for my lunch the next day. Or you could technically dine family style to sample all the "island flavors" that Tonga Room has to offer.

Since it's at the Fairmont, food and drinks are on the pricier side, but it's fun to experience at least once... And possibly again when friends are in town.  It's more of a tourist attraction than anything. And even if you don't dine here, the drinks are pretty good, and you can't beat this ambiance. I look forward to coming here again!!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
We came on a Thursday night before the band started playing and stood at the bar in the back so as not to have to wait for a table (or pay cover I guess).  Our group of four ordered one of the bowls of rum to share and it was made in front of us in a huge tiki bowl and was absolutely delicious!!  It was also very strong.  

The atmosphere is lively, loud and fun for sure.  They have a real boat in the pool that the band plays on and real rain that comes down every so often.  This is certainly a fun place to come with friends and good for really all ages.   Expensive drinks but the food smelled delicious and the huge bowl that we got was actually very reasonably priced.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Beware of strong drinks! They definitely don't skimp out on the alcohol here. 

This place is a little hard to find and the easiest way to get to it is if you go through the entrance marked for the health & wellness gym. There are no signs for the Tonga room on the main floor of the Fairmont so its best if you ask someone that works at the hotel to direct you. 

The service was okay as the front desk staff ask if you are eating dinner or just here for drinks. The group before us was also only here for drinks but had to go to the bar which is standing room only. We were lucky and got a table even though there were plenty of tables open. Once we sat down, our waitress informed us that we could also order dinner so it's a little confusing what the seating protocol is. 

I would only come for happy hour as all the drinks are $10 and the drinks for 2 to share are $20. Otherwise, all the drinks at $15+ which can get quite pricey. We also ordered the poke to share and it came with a little too much mayo but the gyoza chip it came on was super crunchy. 

The "rain" comes on periodically with thunder by the pool area to make it seem like you are in some tropical location. I'm glad I came here thanks to Anthony Bourdain's recommendations but would only come back for happy hour and if a friend was visiting from out of town.
author: Steph D.

description: The food is bad, real bad. You know those burgers you get at Disneyland that taste like cardboard and costs $20... that is gourmet compared to the crap they serve here. I knew we were in trouble when we ordered fried shrimp and the appetizer was delivered to us 3 minutes later. I think half their meals are shoved in a microwave just prior to coming to you at the table. The only thing that kept me from giving it a one star is the ambiance is really outstanding, really makes you feel like you are in the South Pacific. I would say it would be a really good place to grab a drink but horrible to grab a meal. Very disappointing, I would have expected much better from the Fairmont.
author: Adrian S.

description: hmmmm... This place is in the basement of a hotel, so not easy to find.  Definitely lively and fun and LOUD!  Had a fun group drink but it was so sweet three of us couldn't finish it.
author: Kelly S.

description: I give it a 2 nice place we ordered the ribs didn't even finish eating the ribs bec it was to salty very seems like they pour lots of salt on it told the waitress just ignored us. Food is a little bit salty. And also already charge us without even showing us the bill.
author: Jiren M.

description: It's my favourite place. It's my second time. But it's always nice. Cocktails and foods are good. And it's fun watching band and enjoying drinks and food
author: Melody A.

description: Fire alarm went off and they demanded people leave, but not before paying their tabs and finishing their drinks. Some logic should have jumped in there. If you're forcing people to leave because of the fire alarm, Tonga's priority shouldn't be tabs and their cups.  Sounds a lot like Coconut Grove in Boston.... that didn't end well.
author: Shawn B.

description:
This place is a treasure but you have to know how to deal with it. When I lived in SF eons ago, I'd come here a lot, with out-of-town friends. 

I met up with some friends there last night, now an out-of-towner myself. The indoor rainstorm and the ancient tiki atmosphere are still timelessly wonderful, but the same rules still apply.

1. Go for happy hour, 5 pm - 7 pm, Wednesday through Friday. This is a place to start an evening, not end it. (Place closes early anyway.)

Happy hour drinks are $10. (Normally drinks are $18.) I had a zombie last night that was great, and my wife's mai tai met expectations.

2. It is not advised to have a meal here. Just don't do it, and you won't be disappointed. 

So it's pretty simple. You will be charmed by the ancient Tonga Room if you start your night on the town here with a $10 happy-hour tropical drink. You will be frustrated and (if you're especially naive) feel overcharged if you go there to get plastered after 7 pm. 

You will be angry if you eat there expecting great food. But why would you? Only a crazy person would expect this to be a good restaurant.

There are plenty of others in SF, and besides, it's no fun to hunker down in a hotel restaurant/bar for hours when you should be out in the fog exploring your options.
author: Frappy F.

description:
The place is amazing, the Hawaiian style revamped pool is just so unusual but in a good way!
The food was really good though a little pricey, but we knew that before we got there, so no grudges held here!
If I can just add something a little constructive is the fact that they asked us for our name and phone number to put us in a waiting list for approximately 30min even though half of the tables were empty and told us we could wait at the bar. When after 30ish minutes I asked the lady upfront if it was about to be our turn, she just said "yes I guess we could have you seated now" so... was it really a 30min wait or was it just a buffer time for the customers to spend some money at the bar? Unsure... some explanation would have been nice! Transparence is the best option!

Thank you Bash for your help and your smile helping me choose the dish I was going to eat! I highly recommend the Huli Huli chicken
author: Jerome C.

description:
The Tonga Room has brought in a new chef and we were not impressed. Though the setting and environment was fun and delightful, and the staff was very attentive the food just didn't impress. None of the original items we specifically came for such as the Kahlua pork or hana pork were available any more. 

Instead we ordered the baby back ribs and calamari which were great disappointments. The half rack of ribs tasted like generic Americanized Chinese food spare ribs with less flavor and the calamari though visually appealing were so oily that they literally made me gag, i couldn't eat more than 2 pieces. 

Come for the atmosphere and drinks. Skip the food.
author: Jay W.

description: The ambience is super fun and there's a great live band on the weekends. I love the fake storm, the furniture, props and the pool. Food is only ok but I would go back for the drinks, music and overall campy fun feel of the place. If you want to check out a classic San Francisco institution, come to the Tonga room.
author: Hazel Q.

description: Pretty sweet Tiki bar in the lower level of the Fairmount hotel.  Place has a sweet Tiki look going on.  The pool in the middle of the place is a nice touch.  I got there right when it opened up and only food they serve at that time is from the appetizers menu.  Was starved and wanted some nachos.  Drinks were pretty good and no complaints there.
author: Kenneth H.

description: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar was the first tiki bar I've been to and it completely exceeded my expectations. I came here on August 8th, 2018 with a long time close friend and she and I shared two cocktails. They were strong in alcohol content but surprisingly tasted very good. The atmosphere was what made this place extraordinary. There is a pond/pool in the middle of the restaurant/bar and it has a huge boat with live music. The live music band performed a lot of classic hits and made the atmosphere lively and fun. Would highly recommend as a date night spot or a fun hang out with friends!
author: Si Myong Y.

description: This was a fun, corny thing to do in SF. The band was great, and the drinks were on theme. We had fun!
author: Kelly C.

description:
4 Stars for the atmosphere and 2 stars for the tropical drinks.

Atmosphere is great! You have college kids in Hawaiian shirts doing their retro thing on the dance floor and there is 50somthing's doing their "back in the day" thing. The great live house band plays everything from Dona Summers to The Eagles to the latest hip hop. 

The bar area which includes a large dance floor is free admission. It's $10 per person if you like a table with waiter service. 

The drink menu has the liquor and sweetness levels mark on each drink. Which is good because the Zombie was super sweet and had an after taste if Aqua Velvet aftershave. It's hard to get use to the taste. The Jungle Bird was a lot less sweet and the after taste was more mild (a less potent aftershave lotion taste). 

Don't mind the prices on the drink menu because they change on weekends or nights. The Zombie was $19 served in a tall glass (about 13oz) and the Jungle Bird $17.50 served in very short glass (about 6oz). Pricey so make sure you do some "pre-gaming" before coming here.

The décor is an awesome Tiki vibe but the carpet in the table area really needs to be replaced. These drink are loaded with sugar and it seems like the carpet has taken a few spills through out the years. The bar and dance floor area is all wood floors and railings so ever where you touch is very sticky. It just need a very good Windex wipe down.
author: Juan G.

description:
Man, my feelings about this place my feelings about this place we're going up and down during my experience there.

My girlfriend and I came here at the recommendations of a family friend. It was the end of the night and we were tired but we decided to give this place a try. The first thing we noticed on the Saturday night was a line to get into it. We almost didn't feel like waiting but we decided what the hell. It took about 15-20 minutes to get in, which is about our threshold for waiting for a bar.

The second thing we notice, is why people want to come in. This tiki bar looks awesome! There are ornate carvings everywhere, string lights Adorn it to illuminate the place while not making it too bright. And there's a pool of water with a boat in the middle which featured a live band. All the members were in Hawaiian style gear.

The next thing I noticed was the horrible, horrible hysteria to try to get a drink at the bar. There were four or five bartenders but there was about 30-40 people trying to rush at the bar. With everyone requesting their specialty cocktails that are tricky to make, it takes a while to be served. Your best bet is to get one or two rounds of drinks drinks for your party so you don't have to wait a second time. Our wait time for the drinks had to be close to 30 minutes.

Once you're done with that frustration, you're free to drink and use the Dance Floor to listen to the very good cover band. That made up for the terrible drink wait. I couldn't come here all the time but I can see it being a little bit better during a weekday. If I am in San Francisco again, I would definitely return.
author: Derek P.

description: This place is super cool. We didn't eat or stay for the show, you can order a drink at the bar and stand on the deck to check it out and wait for the rain storm, I think it started pouring around 6pm. I Highly recommend the Tonga Kong!
author: Matt G.

description:
Our group decided to stop by this Hawaiian cocktail bar after our lovely dinner a couple of blocks away. While we did not carry a reservation, there were still some opening spaces available so we took the opportunities. Lots of signature drinks to choose from - Mai Tai being the most renown (and probably one of the strongest), so a must-try!

Dancers and singers, this is your time to shine! Towards the center of the bar, the live band was sitting in the middle of a grand pool; music effect was nothing but unbeatable! It was just like dancing inside a big ship with a group of sailors lol.

Wish I could be back and try out more of their optionalities! Great bar!
author: Elaine H.

description: Food was okay. Drinks& food was  overpriced. The band was entertaining. I think the menu could use some reVamping. Good ambience. But the place could use some updating decor.  Btw. We are from the islands of Tonga. Nothing screamed out our real culture.
author: tiffany h.

description: Cool environment. Food is overpriced and terrible. Drinks ok.  Definitely for tourists as a local would never come here.
author: Steve S.

description:
This is an iconic restaurant to visit. Everyone should experience the Tonga Room at least once.  I visited on a Sunday night, April 8, 2018 arrived at 7 PM and was quoted a 45 minute wait. If you have less than 10 people and are not a hotel guest, you cannot make a reservation. We were invited to wait in the Hurricane bar - standing only. The tables are for those who just want cocktails and appetizers.  The wait was the same 45 minutes. The cocktails are pretty pricey but all pretty tasty and are reminiscent of Polynesia. If you are seated at a table after or during the clock striking 8:15 PM when the band starts, you will be charged $10/person cover on your dinner bill. If you walk in after 8:15 PM unless you are a hotel guest the cover is $15/person. We had 5 in our party. We order the appetizer sampler, a beef dish, a pork dish, a fish dish and asparagus. White and brown rice are included. This was plenty of food served family style. Of all the dishes, we didn't like the pork too much. It had a weird flavor but in contrast, the snapper had a sauce that was pretty yummy. A birthday comped dessert was delivered and we ordered a key lime cake to share. Pretty yummy as well served with a passion fruit sauce. 
The 3 piece band was pretty good, playing lots of upbeat danceable, well-known songs. We had a great time.  Our pre-dinner drinks were $55.00 and our dinner with cover charge was $289. You can decide if you think it was worth it - for the fun and atmosphere we thought it was worth it. But if you are looking for outstanding food, then you should skip this throw- back Polynesian experience and 5 star it somewhere else.
author: Jamie Y.

description: Definitely a fun place to hang out, get into the island vibe, and check out some live music. It's not the most luxurious experience, but it's not trying to be that. The live band is very engaging and calls out birthdays and anniversaries. Plenty of table seating but if that's not your cup of tea, there's a standing area and of course bar seating that still offers a good view of the indoor pool. People love to get in the vibe here- so you won't feel out of place if you wear your Hawaiian inspired attire! If you're looking for a chill and entertaining place to let loose and you are into the tiki life, you'll enjoy this place. Lastly, the drinks aren't the best I've ever had but there's a fun range of island inspired drinks if you're in the mood. That's why you came/are thinking about coming here, right?
author: Ana Q.

description: Is the food good? It's okay. Is it worth the price? NO! the food is honestly overpriced $31.00 for two pieces of chicken are you kidding me! The drinks are also somewhat expensive over $15.00 each. The service eeeehhhh it's okay we waited for over an hour because the waiter had forgotten to put our order in. Would I come back? Definitely not. This is one of those restaurants where you go once and not twice
author: Claudia M.

description:
We stopped by here on a Friday night. Although Open Table said there were no reservations available, the Concierge told us that they typically keep some tables open for walk ins. When we arrived, we were promptly seated. The three man musical group was finishing their set, then the rain came. (It rains every 30 minutes in The Tonga Room.) we ordered the mixed appetizer platter, the steak, and the fish special. The servings were more generous than we expected, and the food was tasty. The appetizers accommodate 3 persons and are filling. If we had known this, we would have ordered one less entree.

Around 9 p.m. the night club crowd started to arrive. It seemed to bring in locals as well as hotel guests. The live band was entertaining and played mostly oldies.

The restaurant is kids friendly. We had our 12 year old daughter with us. She enjoyed the 70s and 80s music, the moving stage, and rain in between set. They usually seat families away from the adult crowd.
author: Curtis T.

description: So.  Hmm.  This experience made me discover something upsetting about yelp.  If you scroll to the bottom, you will see "not recommended " reviews that their computer screens out.  They are all terrible.  Believe those.  This is an embarrassment to the city of San Francisco, and has no business serving food to anyone.  We were a group of 10, and there is nothing to recommend. Nothing.  Maybe the chicken wings.  The drinks aren't even clean we to worth what you will pay.  There are a million other places in town.  You should go there, but if you come here anyway, do yourself a favor and do not get food, and really, especially, do not get the snapper.  Or the pork.  Or the beef.
author: Michael S.

description: So much fun! We all had such a great night here. It's so lively, and the live band is great. The crowd is a ton of fun, dancing and singing along, and goes wild when the band on the boat moves in closer. The band is talented, and plays a mix of old school and new songs. The vibe is AWESOME, like you're dancing away on a ship in a tropical locale. The drinks are CRAZY strong! One drink will go a long way! So glad to have found this place in San Francisco's fancy Fairmont hotel.
author: Ke C.

description: I'm always looking for fun and interesting bars in all my trips and this place was one of them. It's inside of the Fairmont Hotel on the lobby level and they have live bands on Friday and Saturday nights. It has a great crowd of hotel guests and visitors wanting to experience the Tonga Rook and it's amazing drinks!
author: Lidia D.

description: The food quality was really bad and it was hard to chew the beef. The service was even worse and we were placed behind the pool where the music was way too loud to enjoy the food/restaurant. I guess the service was really bad because we were a party of 6 and they automatically included an 18% tip. There was also an additional $15/person cover fee for the music. Considering the very low quality of the food, it does not worth it to go to this place and we will never go back again.
author: Reza F.

description:
This is a great stop during a night on the town, but way too expensive for a whole night for what it is. It's a beautiful location with an interesting history, but I've heard of some bad experiences at this bar before. Anthony Bourdain once talked extensively about just how much sugar they put in the drinks.

I shared the two person punch bowl with my date, and it was quite strong. However, by the time we thought we were halfway done, we realized that the punch bowl was half ice! Very misleading! 

The Rainmaker punch bowl may look like a great deal drinkwise, and it's definitely delicious, but for all the ice they put in it, you start to realize you've been tricked. I've never been to a bar where I've had to tell them to go easy on the ice, but I'd never expect to tell them to go easy on the ice on a 34 dollar drink. 

That being said, the location itself is beautiful, but please check online for cocktail reviews beforehand. I did, and plenty of their cocktails were poorly rated (two out of five paper umbrellas), so please be careful here. 

If you're looking for a good time, go here first, then go to Soda Popinski's. If it weren't for the fact that the Tonga Room was a beautiful tiki bar with a band that plays on a floating barge, I would absolutely give it one or two stars for the drinks.
author: Mike P.

description: The Tonga Room at the Fairmont hotel is classic SF. They have a floating stage with live music, it rains indoors every 30mins, and the drinks are strong and good for sharing. What's not to love? My friends and I decided to check it out on a Friday night. We got there at 9ish and it wasn't too busy, but it gets really busy after 10pm - older crowd but still fun. We tried both A Monk Walks into a Luau and The Rainmaker, I think we liked the The Rainmaker better. The drinks weren't too strong imo, but good for sharing. The Tonga Room is one of those places that you just have to check out at least once if you're ever in SF.
author: Elaine N.

description:
3.5/5

The Tonga Room is located inside the Fairmont in SF.
My boyfriend and I made reservations to experience the great fun this place supposedly offered. Little did we know, only customers who are eating there can sit in the well spotted area where the party boat is at...

I kind of find this ridiculous. I still have to pay $10 cover charge per person and pay overpriced drinks, but yet I can't get good seating and instead I am placed in the back of the bar....
Alright Tonga Room, I see you hustling my $$.

The Tonga Room has a crowd of middle-aged adults who seem to had too many sugary drinks in their system. That's because Tonga Room is quite like a grown up playground. Strong Drinks and festive decoration with live music. 

I had fun, it was an experience I had never seen before. One step and you're in fancy pants Fairmont and one step more, you're in crazy Tonga Room.

Come and get a strong tiki drink and then you'll have great fun.
author: Eunice K.

description: I have lived in SF for over 10 years and always wanted to try this place so finally happen on my friend's bday. Place is overrated and the drinks are very expensive, HH drinks are $10, and in my option they are not strong, most drinks are very sweet and it is more about the presentation then anything else. It is very crowded, dark - no windows - and loud place and just not worth the hassle.
author: Magda G.

description:
I'll be rating 2 specific things.  The food and the drinks.  The 3 stars are all for the alcohol.  I really enjoyed the mixed drinks.  And if anyone knows me, I don't usually drink.  But these Tonga Room beverages were scrumptious.  I enjoyed it so much, I had 2.  And let me tell you, they come with a price - monetary-wise and the after effects.  You have to be sure you're ordering wisely because it is cheaper to get a larger quantity.  So if you are starting with a small drink and decide later you want more, just throw down the cash and get the larger glass/bowl.  

Now, for the food.  I can't say people are coming here for the main courses.  The portions are on the tad small side for what you are paying for.  And I found some dishes to be quite bland.  

Overall, it was a cute place.  If you come later in the night, I was told they have a live band, but I was there earlier in the evening so we missed it.
author: Julie C.

description:
Right. So, last review notes the funky taste of the MaiTais. Tonight, we shared a couple's drink off the "new menu", called the "A Monk Walks Into a Luau" . . . more like, "A Monk Squeezes an Alcoholic Drink out of a Used Athletic Sock". No way to describe the taste other than . . . "Shave my tongue now!!!"  Seriously. The drink had some French herbal liquor, and grapefruit juice, and . . . bong water from my next door college roommate??? Just gross.  Done w/ Tonga Bar.

RS
author: Rich S.

description:
On 06/17/2018 my co-workers and I decided to go to Tonga for drinks and dinner.  We initially sat at the bar to order drinks while waiting for our entire party of around 12 to arrive. The bar was not inordinately busy however waiting 15 minutes to get the bar tender's attention to order an over priced Mai Tai at $15 served in a cool coconut shaped mug seemed unreasonable.  Still, given the cool Hawaiian atmosphere complete with indoor pond with rainstorm gave us the desire to stay for more drinks and food. 

We found out the wait to be seated for our party would be an hour and a half.  After being in the bar area for 30 minutes looking at an empty table which would accommodate our entire group, one of my colleagues asked the manager if we could sit there.  She apparently gave permission advising there would eventually be a $10 cover to stay to listen to a band.  We all sat at the table and began looking at overpriced food menus when two bartenders came to us advising it was not open seating and asked us to leave (mind you the table had been empty for 30 minutes, was generating no revenue for Tonga or its employees, and we were a party of 12 willing to order more overpriced drinks and food).  The hostess then came over advising we were not allowed to sit there.  Maybe the restaurant enjoyed empty tables and not making money.  

Based on the complete rudeness of the bartenders, hostess, and another unidentified employee, our party of 12 decided to finish the drinks we ordered and left to eat elsewhere. All of us were in San Francisco on business and were from different states.  None of us were happy with the service from the bartenders or any other employee, nor were we impressed with the prices or the drinks.  Very cool atmosphere but I will never return to Tonga because of this experience.  I cannot believe a restaurant would allow a table for 10 to sit empty while a group of 12 who fit at the table would be asked to leave so the table could continue to sit empty (it was not previously reserved or we would have understood).  Should I return to San Francisco, I will certainly eat somewhere else and not waste my money at this overpriced, under trained, and rude staff.
author: Heather M.

description: I have to start out by saying that the Tonga Room is such a unique Restraunt Bar and it's a very cool place to go for drinks(very pricey though). But to be honest, we were very disappointed with the appetizers. We ordered the pork ribs($20)and poke tostada($16), both were cold(supposed to be warm) and on the bland side. However, I do have to say the Macadamia crusted Mahi Mahi was pretty phenomenal and the Peppered beef was very good too. For dessert, we shared the key lime cake with fresh puréed mango, it was close to a perfect dessert, not to sweet, not too tart. Anyways, all in all it's a neat place to go, it's got a cool vibe to it even without the band playing(extra $15 pp to listen to). For a Fairmont restaurant, I feel like they should try a bit harder to give their customers a bit more of a memorable experience. Appetizers were definitely lacking big time!!!
author: Nola C.

description:
Checked this one off of my bucket list to visit.  There's something oddly charming about all the kitsch.

We came to sit, enjoy the house band and have some drinks and snacks.  Everything was fine.  The band played some fun old tunes.

Drink/food prices are a little steep but you are in the Fairmont after all.  You also will pay $10 fee for house band if you sit down at a table.
author: Brent T.

description: My wife and I stopped in after catching a show at the Masonic. After being told that it would be a 30 minute wait and it would be a $30 cover charge to be seated we agreed and were told we could grab a drink at the bar while we wait. We both had to use the restroom so walked out as the restroom is outside of the restaurant. We come back and the "bouncer" doesn't want to let us back in as there was a line to check in. I explained to him that we've already waited in the check in line and he rolls his eyes and begrudgingly steps out of the doorway. We then proceed to the bar and try to order a drink. I make my way to front and the bartender then takes the order from a group that is behind me. Okay fine, I wait about 10 minutes trying to get the attention of another bartender. Still being ignored. Bartender finishes the group behind me cocktails and proceeds to take another the order from someone whom came after me even though I had been patiently waiting right in from him. After waiting 20 minutes to just to try and get a drink we left. We won't be returning.
author: Steve Y.

description: Just stopped in for a drink. Friendly staff, amazing tiki drinks, and Rain!!! But don't be fooled they can do other drinks too. My Old fashion was perfectly prepared. I will be back!
author: Robert K.

description:
As a guest of the Fairmont in April, 2017, I would give this a five star review. But when I came back in September, 2017, this time as a guest of another hotel, it was a completely different experience and I was very disappointed.

First, the prices have gone up because, from what I understand it, the restaurant is under new management. OK. It's San Francisco and it's at the Fairmont Hotel. Everyone should expect high prices. 

Second, because I was not a guest at the Fairmont Hotel as I was in the first occasion, I could not sit near the water as I had requested. This, despite the fact that there were tables available next to the water  for the entirety of my dinnerthat I could easily have been sent out.

Third, having spent over hundred dollars on dinner for my wife and I, I was told that if we stayed past 8:15 pm there would be a $20 cover charge added to our bill because 8:15 Is when the music started. So, at 8:10, I had to decide whether to buy dessert and incur an additional $20 (on top of the expense of the desert), or end the dinner  a little early. I did not like that at all.


Ultimately, I would recommend eating here, but only if the music is playing (after 8:15) and you are a guest at the Fairmont Hotel. The music is really outstanding. Only 2 stars because I was really jaded after my second visit. 

Update: Thanks for the response. However, the ADDED cover charge of $20 or $30 per couple after 8:15 AFTER IVE ALREADY SPENT OVER $100 ON DINNER IS CRAP.
author: Lou L.

description:
Had a reservation for 2. We were rated right by the water so we had a nice view of the band performing. Service was excellent. The vibe of the place was really nice. Food was good also ordered this alcoholic drink that came in a pineapple was very good. 

It was located in the fairmont hotel which was very nice. Not hard to find. The only thing was we had to pay $35 for parking because the area is sort of crowded so street parking was hard to find
author: Sierra V.

description:
My friend wanted to come here and experiences what it's all about so I invited my sisters to come and experience the restaurant with us. We order the snapper( which they told us they don't do the head of the fish anymore they do the snapper bread wtf!) Korean short ribs did not look like it more like a moist steak but I was really delicious . Fried rice ,spam and shrimp ( salty) asparagus was very tasty. Get the big sample platter that was yummy I think it's better then the main dish. 

Dessert rum cake it good but my sisters thought it was pretty dry. The key lime cake with passion fruit was so tasty.

Overall it was expensive the food was okie and you need to be a guest there if not they will charge you if you stay after 8 pm to listen to their band  which was stupid , just get the check before 8 and watch the live band so you won't be charge that's what we did my advice come with alot of friends so you can try  it but make sure you come at 530 to put your name before everyone else and dinner starts at 630 but you still will be waiting .
author: Hoa T.

description:
Do locals actually go here or it's just a tourists trap? 
Drinks are weak and nasty, and food is OMG WTF?!?! 
The sesame chicken wings I had while waiting for my hubby was the worst!!!!! Drenched in the sweet sauce, and that is pretty much the only flavor they had. 
The mojito I had tasted like store bought mixer (gross) and $17 lol what a joke 

I guess I checked off my life and one thing I would have to disagree with Anthony Bourdin.

Please just walk down the hills. You would actually find more decent bars and food, not worth the time to wait, not worth the dime. No-no-no!
author: Sisi W.

description: Definitely became one of my favorite pubs in the sf. Very lively and awesome drinks & food. I'm so glad their vegan options are so tasty. It's such a rare thing to find these days.
author: Sindhu M.

description:
Atmosphere: extremely loud, crowded 
Food: small portions, extra large price, mediocre flavor
Service: not so great 
Parking: horrible

Not worth the drive in our case, I do not recommend this place. The only consolation was the band.
author: Julie C.

description:
It's as CRAZY as Anthony Bourdain made it out to be on that old episode of No Reservations. Strong Tiki drinks in an over the top polynesian decorated bar inside the Fairmont?? Nuts. The band plays inside the boat, in the middle of the pool, which is in the middle of the bar... And yes, there's rain, thunder, lightning and lots of merriment. People off to the side doing the electric slide, college aged kids singing to Bon Jovi & Neil Diamond. Is this Las Vegas or Nob Hill?? Hahah... So good. You just have to see for yourself. No cover if your just there for the standing room only bar. Otherwise $10 cover for a seat at a table.

Thank you Mr. Bourdain... I never knew. And I lived blocks from here at Pine & Leavenworth. What a San Francisco treasure...
author: Chuck D.

description:
First time at the Tonga Room. Met my expectations and then some. Awesome (BUT STRONG) drinks, great music (on a Saturday night) and seating. We stayed at the hotel so we had priority which was nice and didn't require a reservation. 

A must drink stop in San Francisco and I am so glad that I finally go to check it out. Its pricey, but the drinks are worth it and the time it takes to get them....normally.
author: Sarah M.

description: We entered and it started raining. The band floated out and began playing. We approached the bar and realized there was an incredible Sunday night happy hour. I ordered a Mai Tai and felt at peace with the world.
author: Nick K.

description:
I enjoyed eating here. We arrived when they opened at 5. We had reservations at 6 but since we got a nice table at the bar we enjoyed the drinks and happy hour menu. 
We let them know we were giving up the reservations.

The wings were great. Wish we had ordered more!! The edamame was tasty. Did not like the calamari at all. We left it. Will try the crab claw next time. Loved the ahi tostadas too. Then we all split the Mie Goreng and grilled Escolar. The Mie Goreng was great! Wish it had come with more noodles. Next time I'll ask if we can order extra. 

Tried the Mai tai, the fog cutter, and Jungle bird. Jungle bird was our favorite. My husband said the Mai tai was strong, he switched to beer and at happy hour prices, it was awesome.

We also noticed the drinks were stronger after happy hour.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Got here a little after 5 for the much anticipated happy hour on a Friday night.  Seeing a line we were initially disappointed but soon learned that the line was specifically for those wanting a table and so long as we were willing to stand we could go right in.  

The actual restaurant and bar area is fairly large with all the dining and drinking taking place around a center pool adding to the overall pirate ship theme of the place.  There was a private event going on but the place was spacious enough to accommodate without hindrance.  

The bar was fairly crowded as could be expected for such a trendy spot on a Friday night.  Took a little while to get a drink but overall I thought the bartenders were quick and attentive.  We ordered beers and cocktails off the happy hour menu.  The beer selection was solid but the cocktails were the real draw as they sell several classic and original cocktails.  

The happy hour buffet was $15 per person and I while it was tonga-themed it was really nothing special from purely a food standpoint.  They had fruit, pasta, Tonga fried rice, chow mien, egg rolls, and BBQ chicken wings.  Overall good was average but I suspect the ambiance and/or location in a fancy hotel is at least half the price. 

We had a pretty good time overall.  Probably a bit too crowded and trendy for my taste but a neat experience nonetheless.
author: Dan O.

description:
Every once in a while you get in the mood for a cheesy, expensive, tourist trap spot to hang with friends and family.  And, what better place to be than here at the Tonga Room!

They have uniquely named drinks that have decent flavor but cost way too much.  The food is so-so.  But, the atmosphere is a classic throwback that one cannot deny.  In fact, we saw more and more of a younger crowd coming in to drink and dance to some old school songs.

Oh, and don't forget about the band being on a "boat" amid the lightning and thunder.  Indoors mind you!  LOL!
author: Gene D.

description: The atmosphere and vibe were great. The food was delicious, we got the egg rolls, pot stickers, edamame and coconut shrimp appetizers. All were good. I loved the live band, however, I think they should play more current R&B hits to get the crowd more involved. But it was a great time.
author: Linda V.

description: I love all things Tiki and the Tonga room did not disappoint. Drinks are strong and delicious I only wish that there were souvenir glasses available for purchase as well. Can't miss the band floating on a moving raft in the pool under the occasional rain shower! Also be sure to check out the menus in the hallway from the early days of the hotel featuring meals for under a dollar!! The lobby of the hotel itself is also gorgeous and a definite look through.
author: Kelly B.

description:
I was excited to visit this place after seeing the tropical decor in pics. The interiors looked interesting as expected. We came here on a Thursday evening in a group of 6 ppl or so just before 6pm. When we put our name down, it was probably an hour wait for a table. The bar was very crowded with just enough space to squeeze in and stand. The cocktails were refreshing with its tropical taste and also came at a good price. While having drinks, we noticed there were several tables that were empty for over 30 minutes. The staff gave us attitude while checking our waitlist status. So, the place did have a pretentious vibe. The restaurant started filing up just after 6:30.  After waiting some more time (pretty sure more than estimated wait time), we gave up and had dinner somewhere else. 

In short, this place is good for cocktails and drinks but may not be the best place for a group who are just looking to just chill...
author: Tejashree M.

description: The quintessential tiki bar of all tiki bars. This bar is crawling with tourists and a little bit of an older crowd. The band plays cheesy 80s cover tunes and you have to love the fake rainstorms that occur every so often. Drinks are way overpriced and very sweet. Come on a weekend and you'll have to pay $15 per person just to sit down at table plus whatever you order. I suppose it's the Fairmont and an old-school popular place so they can get away with it. I've been told the happy hour is quite good but I have yet to check it out. If I go again it will be for that.
author: Robert C.

description:
Nice view and atmosphere but pricy food
Reservation is a must and they charge non hotel guests for live music after 8pm
Ribs were overcooked but those fried crab claws were bombbbb
author: Heekyeong Y.

description: This bar had such a great atmosphere I went with my aunt a few months ago and finally got around to writing a review. The food (mainly appetizers) were amazing! We ended up ordering two of everything. I loved the floating band playing live music in the middle of all the tables everyone seemed to be having a great time. The only downfall was that the drinks were NOT well made. They were Very strong and could barely take a sip.  I asked for another one to be made and still didn't quite live up to expectations.. all in all I do still recommend to check it out if your looking for a fun environment with great appetizers!
author: Katie C.

description:
Loved this place hated the crowd. 

But that's on me, my birthday fell on a Saturday this year and thought the Tonga room would be a fun place. Little did I know the place was actually pretty popular. I would definitely return maybe not on a Saturday night.  The pirate ship was  a cool experience to witness the entire room made you feel as if you were on a tropical island! 

Drinks were delicious and the bartender didn't hold back on the alcohol when he made my drink. Which was great since the drinks are a bit pricey. The tiki cups were a great touch that complimented the entire vibe from the bar. The drinks were also beautifully garnished which was a plus.
author: Senay B.

description: What a fun place!!!! We had an amazing time, food was delicious, so tasty but the best of this place is the Mai Tai, omg what a drink, so refreshing, just amazing! Friendly and polite staff specially Tina, she was great, we loved the food suggestion! Thanks Tina!
author: Priscilla G.

description: Loved this place !!! Great vibe . They do charge a fee to see the show like it's not free to go in unless you stay in the hotel. Price is up there but it's San fransisco and it's good food and drinks are good as well. A place to check out for sure .
author: Jesse M.

description:
First time in SF and was told this was a spot that I definitely had to check out.
I watched the episode of The Layover with Anthony Bourdain and got an idea of what to expect so I was excited to visit the location.

Had a reservation and didn't have to wait once arriving at the door. 
We were seated right next to the pool and had a lovely view of all of the action.
The band was already playing and played through to closing time.
The restaurant looks really amazing and has a really great atmosphere.

The food was good but nothing extremely memorable.
My friend and I ordered the Tonga Pupu Platter and you got a good mix of some of the food they offer.

The drinks were dangerously strong... dangerously close to being undrinkable.
I tried three different drinks, a monk walks into a bar (shared bowl), tonga kong and adult swim.
All three drinks were extremely strong which is usually fine but I didn't even finish one because I felt I would be sick if I kept going.

If I make my way back to SF, I probably wont be back unless its for the lounge area but the atmosphere is great and I fully understand why people dine and drink here.
author: Paris S.

description: I came here for my dads 65th bday party and rented out the left side of the restaurant. Can't believe there is a cover charge (although I didnt pay it I still think its crazy!) We had a bunch of food, my favorite being the tuna tartar, shredded pork sliders, tofu (so good, even, though I am not a huge tofu person.) The flan was just okay. I can't remember the rest of the food we ordered however I do remember it was just okay. The drinks were really expensive.
author: Megan A.

description: Great place to stop for a drink. $7-8 beers and ~$15 for a fruity, tropical drink. They have a small dance floor where you can listen to the live music. The band plays classics (Michael Jackson songs and my personal favorite: My Girl) and you'll even get a rain storm show if you time it right. Great atmosphere and a must visit if you're ever in the area.
author: Lauren K.

description: So make sure to book a reservation for this place if you want to sit down at a table. we showed up right at 5pm when they opened, after trying to find parking for 30 minutes and they told us it would be an 1.45 hour wait to sit. and that if we were still sitting past 8 we would have a 15$ cover per person for our party of 5, bc they had a band playing. Since we came all the way just for this place, we got some drinks and hung out for a little while. the place is definitely cool and the storm and rain coming from the ceiling was a fun thing for the kids... just wish they wouldn't have had everyone standing around in small areas and then all these empty tables. didn't make sense at all.
author: Havalah W.

description: I was looking forward to spending my birthday there. My husband called to make a booking but he was told that the restaurant wasn't taking any reservations and was advised to turn up. We showed up around 7pm hoping to have a few drinks at the bar while waiting for a table. However we were told that the restaurant had been fully booked for a private event by the hotel guests. This was very dissapointing as he should've been warned this was the case. We had couple of drinks at the bar instead. Although disapointed, the cocktails were delicous and it's clear the atmosphere at this place was fantastic, i loved the live band on the floating boat, the tropical rain effect added that special feel which made me feel like i was on holiday. We are definitley going back to try to get a table and have a meal there!
author: Dorota C.

description: I came for the bar and drinks, The atmosphere Is awesome but more of an older crowd setting..didn't try the food but would love to bring my kids.Bar didn't have much sitting area and menu for drinks were limited but it is a full bar so if you know what you want just ask.
author: Trielle R.

description:
Crowded!!!! I went to the Tonga Room for girls night out and it was only by luck we got to sit down. We did not make reservations (we are a large party and it was an impulse decision). Learn from our mistake- make a reservation! The Tonga Room gets sooo crowded sooo quickly! 

Besides that, my drinks were DELICIOUSLY strong. After a few sips, I felt better about everything! The Tonga Room is a fun place to hang out- if you can sit down (happy hour bar is mostly standing room only- with a few tables)! 

Loved my limited experience- but I will not go back unless I only stay for 1 drink- or we have reservations.
author: Charissa N.

description: Didn't know much about it except that I saw it on an episode of Top Chef which made me really want to check it out. Definitely worth it! Wait was supposed to be 45 mins for a table but it ended being only a couple of minutes. Went for drinks and dessert. We were warned that if we stay when the band starts playing we will get charged $10 per person on our bill. A little much since we didn't order a lot so made sure to get the bill before the band came out. There is an area where you can just stand to enjoy the music without the charge. Such a fun idea, would recommend for anyone visiting SF.
author: Jo S.

description: Hostesses were horrible .. They make you wait for an unreasonable time when there are tables available. They charge $15 if you sit at the bar or at a table to eat food/drink. However, if you sit at bar you get no view of live entertainment and anyone who can just walk in can block you and watch the entertainment for free. Makes no sense. You can't make reservations for parties under 10 unless you are staying at the Fairmount. I think it's a cute place to just stand and watch a bit of the live entertainment. I think it is best to skip eating especially in the bar/lounge area.
author: Tara D.

description: Decent, but really pricey for what you get. People pretty much come here because it's a San Francisco classic in a cool environment, but I wouldn't expect great food. I would just suggest coming here for drinks and hanging out.
author: Cynthia M.

description: This place has a really cool atmosphere, but get there early! To get there go into the Fairmont, and go straight back down the amazing spiral staircase. We asked the Bell hop and they were more than happy to point us in the right direction. If you use the elevator it's floor T, 2 floors below ground level.
