We went on a Saturday night around 6 and it was already pretty full in the bar and dining had over an hour wait. They have standing room around the bar and in an area next to the water. The drinks are STRONG, so we thought we got what we paid for... they range from $15 to over $50! The band was setting up before we left. They float on what used to be he hotels pool! Every half hour there's a "show" that includes it "raining" and some thunder and lightning. We were glad because it was hot down there and it cooled it off!
author: Chrissy R.

description:
Im a big fan of tiki and happy the Tonga Room is still going strong, nestled in on the ground floor of The Fairmont hotel on Nob Hill in San Fran.  
The nightly Polynesian musical shows that take place from a moving barge in a lake- like water feature in the middle of the restaurant are entertaining. 
The tiki drinks are good, the food is fair but I just love Tiki!
This place is quite big but gets packed so make a rez or stay at the hotel for VIP access.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I've always enjoyed a visit to the Tonga Room.  Back in the day (about 10 years ago), I would go grab a table and get a drink or enjoy their happy hour buffet thing.  Nowadays it seems you need a reservation to get a table and there are no seats at the bar.  This was a bit of a shock to me when I arrived and had to squeeze into a little spot at the bar to enjoy my happy hour drink (at least it was still happy hour priced- mind you that means $10).  I did come back with family later and got a reservation.  The music was great and the food was pretty good.  The drinks are definitely a lot more at the table, but it was nice to be able to enjoy the atmosphere.  The kids got their juices into cocktail glasses complete with fruit and mini-umbrellas (huge hit!).  They loved the "rain storms" and the floating band.  I'll be back again and I hope not much will have changed.
author: Meredith R.

description: A classic....kitsch and tiki and yummy.  The food is delicious (the salmon tostada appetizer!!) and the waiters gracious.  Don't expect to sit on the 'lagoon' if your party is big (over 5) and make a reservation if you don't plan to sit in the bar (you will likely wait a long time if you want just the bar, it is usually crowded)    The biggest drawback is the band.  Such a pathetic band.  Bad covers of 70s and 80s songs, at a volume that could strip the paint off the walls--don't plan on talking to anyone when the band plays.  They need a slack key forward, Tiki themed band!
author: Leslie H.

description:
There's a warm spot in my heart for Tonga room. I think there are a lot of contributing factors: 

1) It's so unique for an SF institution. Tonga Room is way better than Smuggler's -- too crowded and expensive there. bleh) 
2) Great HH. My favorite in the city - it's $10 for their usual tiki drinks that can run you $15 on average. 
3) STRONG drinks (good bang for your buck - I order the Zombie and it's like the strength of 2+ drinks. Tastes a bit medicinal but you can venture for creamier ones or more traditional ones.
3) The rainstorm - actually it's a bit sad because they're just sprinklers on the ceiling but adorable that they tried. 
4) The ambiance itself is so fantastic. It's so kitschy, a bit over-the-top ridiculous, but so vibrant and colorful at the same time. 

I won't rave about the buffet but I'd go for drinks after work. Environment is spacious, there's plenty of seating and I've never had a problem with the staff.
author: Cindy W.

description:
It is a hard one because if this were all about food and drinks I really don't think I'd given it a 3 star.   But because I don't think it is at all about food I figure they meet the exceptional 3 star rating.

We were a little Leary to go because it was a special occasion, so we didn't want to be rushed.  I wasn't interested in the band so if you stay past 8:00 pm the add a $10 surcharge to the guest at the table.  

We arrived at 6 but it took someone 5 minutes to greet us at the host stand, they sat us at a nice table and reminded us that at 8:15 they would add the band surcharge.  Once seated we were greeted and served water and the server who was most gracious came over and talked to us about the drinks.... by this time it was 6:30 before we even ordered appetizers.  

The drinks were ok, I didn't think they were with $15 each... but again I realize it was a special occasion.  We got the appetizer which was a combination of the appetizers. I did like the Poke Tostada.  By this time we had been enjoying our drinks and appetizers but time had slipped by so fast it was already 7:45, so we decided to get our check and move on to a place that our $20 would be better spent on food and not on a band cover charge.

The old school Disney ambiance was fun and the service was great... but if food is a very important criteria then the appetizer was an indicator that Perhaps don't have to high an expectation.
author: RS M.

description: Horrible. We were so excited about this place but pretty sure I was poisoned with tainted alcohol from half of a drink. Beware! They make you pay to get a table. I started feeling very strange and had to leave before our food came. Tables were pretty empty. Really bad memory for me. I think someone should test the alcohol there and see if it's wood alcohol or something.  Just from a few sips of a drink I was horribly ill. I fell and hit my knee. Something just isn't right here!
author: Erin P.

description: Very disappointed ! The food had  no taste . I ordered the fish and tasted very fishy and dry , also it's meatless . The lemon chicken?!  ... you meant popcorn chicken , right ? $27 for it ! No sides beside lemons , hahahahaha  . JFK makes better . No kidding! . Whatta waste of money . "Spicy Edamame "? There's nothing spicy about it . It's very greasy ! The papaya salad was  so so . Overall , untasted food , service very slow , drinks ? Omg nothing special either . The only good thing in this place is the environment and the band . Oh ! the hostess was very nice ! I don't recommend and I won't return .
author: Marilise F.

description:
I finally got myself out to the Tonga Room by dragging my team or for a goofy birthday dinner. This is a three and a half star review. 

It's the definition of tiki-tacky in the best way. The lol is campy and fun, the rain is entertaining, and having a band play on the boat keeps it fun. If you can, go for happy hour. Prices are better, and they are overall pretty steep. They don't accept reservations unless you are staying at the Fairmont, so keep that in mind. We got there early, before dinner service started, and only happy hour was available. I got a fog cutter, and it was quite good, for a fog cutter.

We ended up getting a happy hour table, and another round of drinks, so tried a scorpion bowl or two... Honestly, the flavors were not great. The "a monk walks in to a luau" was very medicinal, and no one really liked it. The other was much better received.

So to assure we could stand, we got a few apps. The poke was solid, and the wings were fine, but the calamari was overly breaded and tough. We moved to a regular table, and got mains. I had the racist and was very happy with it. The crab cake was also excellent. I think a few people were less plussed about the stir fry dishes. 

The service was slow. It took a long time to order, and we had to chase down the bill at the end of the night. While fun and kitschy is lovely and the food was solid,  the speed of service and waits for no reason took away from the experience... And one of the bowl drinks was actually pretty disgusting.
author: Erin O.

description:
My friend made reservations for 3 at 6p on a thursday and we were seated on the dot. The queue started forming right around the evening so it's safe to say that it's better to make a reservation before coming. 

I didn't catch our server's name but his service was great!  I noticed that he was catious to interupt our conversations.  If someone was in the midst of chatting, he would quietly wait on the side before catching everyone's attention.  

I got the Hurricane cocktail and it was strong!  I came in a large glass, bigger than most cocktails listed on the menu I think.  Maybe bc I'm a lightweight but I wasn't able to finish my one drink by the end of dinner!  The food was delicious as well.  I forget the exact dish name but the pork was really tender and juicy.  

A cocktail and an entree came out to be ~$66 after tax and tip FYI. Food and drinks are a bit overpriced imo but I enjoyed the experience.  Have to try it once, especially if you're visiting the city like I was (yes, I fell in the tourist category... I'm not sure if I'd go here often if I were to live in SF though).  It was also my first tiki room experience ever so I was really pleased with Tonga Room!
author: Victoria L.

description: Really enjoyed the drinks, but found the ambience a little contrived.  Will absolutely come back!
author: David R.

description: This place is an sf institution. With its super sweet drinks, indoor hurricanes, and Hawaiian style live music. It's hard to not fall in love immediately with the pure magic that's hidden away under such a majestic hotel. I always have a great time here, I only have positive reviews on this one. The drinks are pricey but also strong and on the bigger side-so you're definitely getting your money's worth.
author: Cindy B.

description: Okay, if you are coming to SF looking for a fun time with a live band (!!!), sugary drinks which will hype you up for a live band and an overall great time you must come to the Tonga room. Like others noted, the line to get in may be long and you may wait a while for your $16 piña colada. Do not expect short waits nor cheap drinks here. However, the experience is what makes it worth the 5 stars. I can say with certainty that I have never been to such a cool tiki bar in my life. Of course it's gimmicky and cheesy but lighten up! This was such a fun place to pretend like we were in Hawaii and dance to the live music! This is an experience you won't regret!
author: Mary Kate R.

description: I've heard great things about the Tonga Room but I am honestly amazed at how atrocious the large group reservation service is. I have been trying to get in touch with someone for three days to schedule a party for my wife's birthday and I cannot reach a human-being to save my life. There is no direct line that is ever answered at the restaurant and in calling the hotel lobby the operator just transfers me to the vacant phone line. It's the worst experience I have had at any restaurant, ever.  I have left multiple voicemails for Alexis who runs their reservations and she has been relatively unresponsive/unhelpful. It would seem the Tonga Room is in the fortunate position of having more business than they know what to do with because I have never encountered a more apathetic group of employees.  If you are able to speak with someone who works there, let alone secure a reservation, count yourself among an elite class of highly fortunate individuals.
author: Cameron F.

description: I mean, what a delight from start to finish. I was in San Francisco just for the weekend and was looking for a nice meal to round off the trip - this certainly did not disappoint. The band was amazing and the hurricane rain added that extra bit of bizarre wonderment. We had the appetizer platter, the noodles and some amazing tofu dish and each thing was more delicious than the last.
author: Ellyn H.

description: C'mon!  Nothing wrong with this place. Expensive?  Sure, but it's in the grandest hotel in perhaps the most expensive city in the US. Nothing but pure fun and a helluva buzz for under $100. My wife and I drank rum drinks concocted for two, and danced to a fun and energetic 80s cover band on a Friday night. Anthony Bourdain would have been proud...of at least part of that experience.
author: Ray F.

description:
The music was awesome but the environment was kinda old-fashioned.
It was a good experience though!
author: Mahdieh G.

description: Silly.  A one time must do for sure, and the drinks are actually pretty good and strong.  But the food is overpriced and there was a $10 per person cover after 8pm for the cover band.  Not worth it.  We had a couple drinks, laughed, took some photos and then went elsewhere for dinner.
author: Shanna K.

description: As my readers may know, I'm a sucker for for all things tiki. That being said, the Tonga Room was a bit of a let down. I'll sum it up as touristic and stuffy with overpriced drinks ($15 for a pina colada). No happy hour and overhead sprinklers/ strobe light lightning had people laughing rather than awed. Lobby bar upstairs is way more impressive.
author: Ryan C.

description: My favorite restaurant in SF for last 20 years. Last few years it starts going down. Less decorations and really poor menu. But pool and thunderstorm with tropical raindrops still there. I traditionally come here with whole my family on my birthday. Still sit by the pool still enjoying life band. Food could be better though.
author: A C.

description: Ok so we stopped in here for some tropical drinks at the bar. At 5:00 pm the joint is packed. Tonga is located under the Fairmont hotel. We had a jet pilot and a fog cutter.  Tasty and powerful stuff they serve here! The decor is all tiki kitschy and exactly what you think it is. There is a pool in the center of the restaurant and it rains from time to time. There is also a band on a barge in the center of the pool.  We came for drinks and did not sample the food. Overall, recommend.
author: Jerry M.

description: We were in SF for a couple of days and I've been wanting to try this place for awhile, so we decided to check it out for dinner. We arrived on a Saturday at 7:30, and knew right away that that was a big mistake. The place was suuuper jam packed, the hostess was stressed out and frazzled, and there was a 2 hour wait. We decided to come back the next night, and it was much better. Well, except for the frazzled and stressed out hostess, she was there again, and had the same disposition. We all agreed that she should not be the first interaction customers experience when they dine here. There was another hostess, who looked hawaiian, and she was super sweet and professional. We were seated right away at a table near the water. There was a $10 per person cover charge for the band, which we didn't mind (the band was really good!). We had the hulu chicken, the pineapple fried rice, and the short rib. All were very good. The prices are a little steep, especially for the drinks, but I think that since the restaurant has such an interesting and fun ambiance, it was worth it. Definitely a special occasion place, but worth the splurge!
author: Caroline T.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for a while so booked a month ahead. I booked via OpenTable- I wish their app mentioned there is a cover on weekends. It's silly they should have a minimum or something. 

Had great seats watching the live band play. Island vibes and very corny music. Band played 'do you ever see the rain' and it started raining. Ha. Drink was okay- had one of the fishbowls/dragonbowls and shared with two friends

Great place for dancing 
Not for conversation
author: Amanda M.

description: The ambiance is wonderful, but the food doesn't match. I've had better pineapple shrimp rice from my hole in the wall in Berkeley. Definitely an experience, but not one that needs to be repeated. The potsickers were decent.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
It's an interesting setting totally for tourists or older people.  We got there at 930 pm and only had to wait 10 min to get into the standing bar area.  No cover on sat night for standing.  

It's a large standing area and packed. It felt like we went to a different city as soon as we walked in.  However it's just not our vibe.  A band playing oldies on the island in the middle and lots of older folks dancing or enjoying.  

Am sure this place is good for some people however I started to yawn.  At least I checked it out.  It just wasn't our music or scene.  Took an uber to broadway to bamboo hut.  Feels much more lively
author: Lei H.

description: Great experience. Great service. THE TINIEST PORTIONS I'VE EVER SEEN.  We stopped and got a pizza afterwards. The food tasted great, but I was beyond disappointed in the amount of food that was given in an entree. Overall... glad I came here, but I won't come back.
author: Blair D.

description:
Omg
Worst tourist trap, wallet Wrangler EVER
Yes we showed up on Valentine's, but there were tons of empty tables. We were seated at the bar but told because a band was playing, we'd be charged a ten dollar surcharge each. No problem with that.
The issues started twenty minutes after we'd been seated and no waiter had swung by. My husband goes to the bar to order one tiki drink and a jack on the rocks. Bartender is watching the band because there's literally nobody at the bar but he won't take my husband's order because he says that's the waiters job. A few minutes later and no waiter Insight the bartender finally takes my husband's order and he comes back to the table. The waiter decides to run around and ask if we're okay. After a few minutes of terrible service we decide to leave. After a few minutes of waiting for the waiter to come back to ask him for the check my husband finally gets up and decides to ask the bartender who tells him we have to wait for the waiter. The waiter finally comes with the check and we attempt to pay but again the waiter took too long to come back and as we attempted to get the bartender to check us out he tells us the waiter has to help us.$37 for one Tiki drink and one Whiskey on the rocks (this isn't even with the $20  additional charge they said they were going to add for the  band playing because they forgot to include that) and we were done. we got our Tiki mug we took our pictures but we will never be back.
author: Yvette M.

description: On our trip to SF we wanted to make sure we stopped in to at least one tiki bar. The Tonga Room was it. Located in some swanky hotel we made our way in. We got there 15 minutes after they opened and had to wait an hour to get seated. Yes they're that busy so get in early or make a reservation. We didn't stay for the show but the water works were pretty cool. The cocktails aren't bad, they're definitely generous with the main ingredient. I ordered the jet fighter... more like jet fuel that's stuff will put some hair on your chest, my fiancé ordered a coconut coffee drink and dang that one was tasty.
author: Edgar M.

description:
This website is not helpful! I'm trying to book a hotel room and enjoy a good evening with my wife for her birthday and all the numbers posted on the website aren't in service or don't work, poor direction on how to book a hotel, or at least to give a link. Does anyone know how to contact the hotel? I'm trying to go @5pm because it sounds like people wait forever for s simple dinner?

One star and I haven't even been to it, because the website direction is poor, phone numbers won't work. If they want customers I'd think they'd fix this
author: Miguel O.

description: The Tonga room has history and ambiance to be sure. Glad we experienced it, but the tiki drinks were subpar compared to all the other places we have been. The list of drinks is too short as well. Try smugglers cove instead. The drink called the Demerara dry float was the best tiki drink I've ever tasted. I mean it was mind blowing!!! And I've experienced many tiki places over the years. I'm from Los Angeles so if you are ever down here, try the tiki ti. It's been around since the early 60s. And the drinks...well, you will just have to experience them for yourself.
author: Helia J.

description: Staff is very stuffy and not welcoming, no one smiles. Mai Tais where delicious, food was mediocre at best. But the entertainment was GREAT, thanks Island Groove for making our night!
author: Joe C.

description: A very "San Francisco" experience with a pool in the middle of the bar, which has rainfall and a band that were in a boat type area, which comes out from the rear and into the middle. This is later in the evening.  Great!  Bar Staff is always delightful along side with the service staff. They no longer take reservations so be prepared to wait about 30 minutes but the wait is well worth it. The band is always playing the hits and the drinks are great!
author: Darla G.

description:
Tonga is certainly more of an overrated restaurant. I came with a party of 9 and we all felt as though the prices should've been significantly lower for the quality of their food and drinks. With that being said, as the server was attentive, it almost felt as if he was pressuring us to add more dishes. To mention, we ordered 6 dishes, 2 cocktails and 1 large cocktail to share with four people. 

Prior to being seated, we were informed that we'd be charged $10-$15 per person for the live band that started at roughly 8:15pm. None of us wanted to stay for the live band because we don't have interest in such music so we opted out. As we asked for the bill, our server stated "Is it because you guys don't want to pay for cover? It's okay if that's why you want to leave; this happens to a lot of my tables." We were offended because even if this was true, this shouldn't have been said very bluntly. If a party wishes to leave, the server ought to provide the bill when asked. 

Don't get me wrong, the view was great, hence one additional star for decor. Though, we won't be back.
author: Sophie C.

description: The place is good for birthday parties. The best dish is the beef steak! If you're not hotel customer, you will pay 15 usd for each person extra couver.
author: Hatice S.

description:
Since I grew up in San Francisco in the 50's/60's, I used to go to the Tonga Room and chat with the Hawaiian Band. Back then, the band played Hawaiian and tropical songs which brought you back to the Islands.
After being away so long, my wife wanted to come back and relive those moments, but to our dismay, the band played Pop songs, nothing to whisk you away to paradise. Now, it's all about money.
The service was here nor there. Servers walking back and forth from the kitchen with their carts of food or pitchers of water. They had no time to stop and chat. Where is the WELCOME to the Tonga Room and how is your day going?? I don't even know the servers name. 
We started with the Pork Sui Mai $15 which had pork and shrimp. That was very good, but you only got 5 dumplings. I ordered the Tonga Chow Mein with Beef, $29. My wife ordered the Seared Diver Scallops, $28 which had 4 large scallops and my sister ordered the Mongolian Beef, $25. We added a plate of Wok Tossed Asparagus. $10.
The Tonga Chow Mein dish had slabs of tender beef chopped in 2x2 or more inch pieces. !. Why didn't they slice it thin? Maybe, because 'time is money'@The noodles where the thick yakisoba noodles not your normal Chinese noodles. The Gai Lan (Chinese broccoli) could have been cooked for another minute or two. The good thing was the not so crispy mushrooms and the unsliced Oyster mushrooms. Could have better chow mein in Chinatown just a couple of blocks down.
My wife enjoyed her scallops and my sister enjoyed her beef dish which again, the beef needed to be sliced bite size.
The wok fried asparagus, for us, was a hit, cooked just right with the ginger soy glaze.
We didn't order drinks or dessert because I was so disappointed with the venue and I don't think we'll be back. Sorry. 
If you want a taste of Paradise, you need to check out the San Francisco Hawaiian Events in the Bay Area.
ALOHA!!
author: Charles D.

description: Amazing service and ambience. I went for happy hour and stayed for Dinner! Had a table right by the water and stage show. Awesome!
author: Alicia B.

description: So overrated I can't even explain to you. Also the hostesses are extremely rude. I wouldn't waste my time going here if I were you. Mediocre at best.
author: Madison G.

description: My parents have been coming here for years and once I moved it was a definite must. Neat to see the history of the building this bar is in now. Tasty cocktails too!
author: Emily M.

description: Ok this place is interesting. Thought it was super swanky and exclusive until we finally got a table and realized it's a knock off rainforest cafe. I really can't figure this place out. The service was not good- I didn't get a single refill on my water and wings were stinky af but it was definitely an experience. Being trendy New Yorkers we got played big time thinking we got into something lit. There's a random swimming pool in the middle of the restaurant. I just don't get it. Whatever we had fun.
author: Jackie P.

description: Really overpriced!!!! It's inside the Fairmont and they do not take reservations so it was nearly a 2 hour wait. I'd find somewhere less "tourist-y" and find some better food. The live music was good however keep in mind you have to pay a $15 cover to listen on top of your dining bill, and most cocktails range from $15-60 so be prepared $$$.
author: Alex E.

description:
I was really looking forward to coming here. It's such a cool space, even better than it looks in photos -- and the food and drinks are really fun, especially the drinks that come in a coconut, tiki mug, or pineapple shell. 

Unfortunately, the music was SO loud, my friends and I were basically screaming at each other all night, and still couldn't hear each other. Every time the band would take a break, we would breathe a sigh of relief, but then they would start up again and we would basically give up on talking to each other for another hour.  

We asked our waiter at one point if it would be possible to turn down the music, and they sighed and said "I wish the same thing, every night! I hate not being able to hear what people are ordering!" 

So, I'm not going to be coming back, unfortunately. If it weren't for the extreme volume problem this would be a favorite spot of mine.
author: Anne P.

description:
Unique experience and a fun concept but keep your expectations low on dinner and service. Decent food at high prices, served slowly and with hidden cover charges if there's live music-- beware. 
Definitely worth having a tropical drink and checking out!
author: Allison L.

description: I only came by for the bar but was not too happy about the $10 cover that is requested if you want to stay to watch the band. If you're going there for dinner or a drink, it seems tacky to ask for more money later. Why not just have people buy a certain drink or entree minimum instead? I can't comment on the food, but the piña colada I ordered was delicious. The crowd seemed kind of older but I did realize that I went during the time of some conference that was going on in the area so I'll have to try this spot again during my next SF visit.
author: Crystal Marie G.

description: Such a fun place! It's a tiki themed restaurant and bar in the beautiful Fairmont hotel. I came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. We got seated for dinner within about one minute. Although if you come here for dinner and aren't staying at the Fairmont hotel then there's a $15 cover charge. For dinner we shared the Korean short ribs. They were so tender and delicious! Although extremely overpriced for the tiny portion. As for cocktails my favorite was the Adult Swim and Hurry Kane. My boyfriends favorite was the Hurry Kane as well. The Planter's punch and the Tonga Kong were our least favorites. Overall very pricey place but quality food and drinks. And the atmosphere is amazing with the band playing on a boat in the water and lots of dancing!
author: Jessica B.

description: What a fun experience! Definitely overpriced for not that amazing food but it's a fun place to get some drinks and listen to live music! Def have to stop here at least once in your life if you are visiting sf
author: Avery A.

description:
Kinda cool, but kinda touristy-trappy. The line usually gets long later in the night (10pm) 

The music is cool and water is cool. Drinks are expensive. I like the alcohol and sweetness rating on the menu!
author: Kelly G.

description: I don't think it is possible to come here and not have some fun. The house band playing on an actual boat in the middle of the room were very good. The cocktails were pricey and came out of a bottle, but I know that I am here for the rain showers, the dance floor, and the 50's style glasses that they are served in. It is nice to have a drink and remember not to take yourself too seriously.
author: Dylan K.

description: This place is amazing!  Great decor, food and entertainment. Our server Alex was great. I came here on a recommendation from Anthony Bourdain's TV show. Anthony is eight about this place.
author: Pete B.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to hang out when we were in college.  It's amazing how they maintained this place well. Still Pretty classy in my opinion, yet casual.  I see many people come here just to have a drink, but we come here for the food.

This place can make you feel you're trap in a tropical island with indoor rain, great food, romantic music, and unlimited drinks.  We always get great service here that's why we like to come here.

You want to impress someone?  You can't go wrong with this place.  

A little pricey for valet parking but it's worth paying it.  Some streets are way to steep to parallel park and at times too cold and windy to walk a couple of block at nights.

You won't be disappointed.
author: Grace L.

description:
This is a classic must visit if you go to San Francisco.

Don't go for the food, go for the Boat in the Pool, the history and the dancing.  By your second MaiTai you're not going to care whether the PuuPuu's are authentic, or that the band has been playing the same style of non Hawaiian Music for a long long time.  Because, next time you are in San Fran you are absolutely going to go again (if you have the time or energy) because.. well, wow their drinks are strong!  and You will have a GREAT time in a wonderful restaurant that has been there before your GrandMother was born!

Aloha and Mahalo
author: Alicia G.

description: Great ambience! Good food. Would have been great if they took reservations.
author: Ravi R.

description:
This is a pretty neat place to have a drink. There's a floating boat in the middle for the performers to stand in. There's water and rain water coming down from the ceilings and it's a night time tropical theme. 

Their drinks are also island themed, featuring coconut and pineapple flavors. There are plenty of other ones as well. They have snack bites of Asian fusion like variety. The food was alright but I really liked the ambiance. 

On Christmas day they had a live band.
author: Glo Y.

description:
Kitschy place with overpriced drinks and a campy environment. While the "Hurry Cane" did have me leaving a bit cross eyed, it was also $24... ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ 

Furthermore, I was told I can't sit down at any of the 50 open tables because I was not eating (it was 10PM on a Thursday and the place was not crowded at all).
author: Austin C.

description: If Anthony Bourdain says its a must stop, then it must be good right? I mostly agree with him, but drinks here are overpriced (~$50 w/ tip for 2 drinks). That said, it is a checklist item while in SF. The fact that it "thunders" and rains from the ceiling is a unique event that you won't be able to experience anywhere else. There is a lot of history here for sure. Be warned, it gets crowded on the weekends, so try to come early.
author: J. B.

description:
I've been meaning to come here for the last year or so since I heard about it from one of my friends....so glad I finally got a chance to check it out!

Came here last night (Wed) around 7:30pm with a group of 6 friends. One girl had gone earlier and saved us a table, but it didn't seem to be super crowded, probably because the first Warriors vs Cavaliers game was going on at the same time!

I can't speak to the food because I only had a drink here, but I thought the drinks were about what you'd expect from a tikki bar...lots of rum cocktails with tropical flavors mixed in. I got the Island Margarita for $12, and it was pretty tasty. No complaints there!

I absolutely enjoyed the feel of the whole place. They've gone to great lengths to create that tropical island atmosphere, complete with a pool of water in the middle, periodic "rain" accompanied by thunder, and even the beginnings of a ship's rigging! 

Once it hit a certain time (around 8-8:30), the live band started playing and some people started dancing on the wooden deck of the "ship". They looked like they were having a blast!

My one minor complaint about my experience last night was that it was a little bit stuffy inside, but I took it all in stride and treated it as part of the tropical humid atmosphere.

Check out my pics to get a sense of what it looks like inside!
author: Dianna H.

description:
You have to come here at least once for the vibes, music and drinks but I wouldn't make it a regular thing. The drinks, while unique and exciting, are expensive...but they're kind of worth it considering the ambiance and the tiki bar element. If you order something off the menu expect to pay $11 - $15! The menu has them rated by strength and sweetness.

The band was AWESOME and they perform from a moving boat on the little body of water. The dance floor and music reminded me of a wedding in the best way possible. The crowd was definitely older (I'm in my early 20s) but it was a good experience overall :)
author: Hana S.

description: I wanted to go here because of I saw it on a show on food network. Not as great as I thought it would be. With that being said, it had very cool decor.  It is a good place for a drink or two.
author: Angela R.

description:
It's been almost 20 years since I last came here with the family for my parents' anniversary dinner, and the place looks just like I had remembered it.

After hearing that they revamped their cocktail menu back in October 2016, I was excited to try them given my love of tiki drinks.  Unfortunately, the cocktails were very much a mixed bag with the 1934 Zombie being completely undrinkable...each sip literally tasted like a shot and it was unbearable after a few sips.  A complete waste of the painfully steep $18 it cost.  The only decent concoction was the 1944 Mai Tai, others were too sweet, excessively creamy, etc.

The atmosphere is unique and worth at least a brief stop for anyone who's never been here, but the wildly overpriced, poorly executed cocktails were a huge letdown.
author: Eric F.

description: Very crowded, drinks very expensive. You had to pay $10 just to sit down (per person) it's an old swimming pool in a basement turned into some sort of tropical room-cheesy
author: Penny S.

description:
The Tonga Room is fun after a long day shopping!
Located in the basement at the Fairmont Hotel. It's lively and fun. Good drink, food and music with fantastic ambiance!! Highly recommend this place!
author: Nancy M.

description:
Anthony Bourdain approved, so we had to check it out! 

What an awesome place! A live band was playing amongst an indoor tropical storm while we sipped mai tais and ate delicious Asian/Hawaiian inspired food. We asked for the drink that came in a skull, like the one we saw on The Layover and our waitress laughed and said that everyone asks for that, yet they don't serve that type of drink! No problem, we enjoyed the Lava Bowl and other delicious concoctions. 

The location is a little difficult to find, it's literally in the underbelly of the hotel, but the ambiance and service is definitely worth experiencing!
author: Kate S.

description: If you want a place with bad food and bad music this is it! Oh and bad cocktails to compliment it all
author: Inesa A.

description:
Anthony Bourdain made me come here.  After watching his SF layover episode, I knew I had to check out the mecca of cheekiness and 50's kitsch.  It's all that and more.

It's fun for happy hour and bringing a few friends- a show on the water and plenty of people watching on the side.  Worth a stop in if you appreciate the eccentricities and quirkiness of the city.  And if you like getting exercise, you can easily walk up the hill from the Union Square BART station....
author: Christine S.

description:
I've been going here for nearly a decade, even before I turned 21! I stopped by yesterday with a friend to find out they no longer do the happy hour buffet, which was what we were craving. My friend and I ended up ordering drinks as well as a few items from the happy hour menu, which was no where near appetizing. 

The chicken wings were lightly flavored with what smelled like a fish sauce, paired with what seemed like a sort of spicy aioli. The server that brought out the fried calamari paired it with this sort of cilantro vinaigrette. As he set it down, he mentioned other sauces were available for the fried calamari should this one not suffice. However, when we asked another server for the other sauces, she had no idea what we were talking about. We did appreciate the constant filling of our glasses of water. 

This place has been a staple in my life for good drinks and yummy bar bites. I have noticed the change in management and overall staffing this past year as well as price differences. However, it did not feel the same to me this time around, and I am no longer excited for or looking forward to going here like I used to be. Would I go again? Possibly one more time before the year is over, at least once or twice a year. 

I still give the place credit for its investment in theming and for how long its been around.
author: James Nikko M.

description: Great food and fun atmosphere! Terrifically ticky tacky AND on our way out, a hotel guest was walking her pet pig!  #winning
author: Karen R.

description: Terrible service tonight. Even though there were lots of empty tables we had to wait 40 minutes to sit down. They changed the menu since the last time I was here and the new drink selection isn't as good as it used to be.
author: Ame K.

description:
Alright, so if you're going to come here, you're coming for two things: A) the ambiance, and B) the drinks. 

A) The ambiance: It's cute, it's kitschy, it's fun. There is an indoor "lake", rain every 30 minutes, palm fronds, and flowers. It really is adorable, and the Fairmont's done an excellent job maintaining this historic bar.

B) The drinks: Having never been to a tiki bar before, I was definitely a bit amazed by the drinks. Man, they are STRONG. No half shot of vodka washed out with tonic here. These are good drinks with good strong (but not cheap) alcohol. I had the 1944 Mai Tai, which was delicious, and the Jet (Plane? Something?), which was a bit stronger and had a nice spiciness to it (as in cinnamon/nutmeg). 

To be honest, the appetizers are "meh." I still recommend ordering one to prevent excessive tipsiness, but they're all standard.

TLDR: Come for a drink or two and relax every once in a while - it's worth it :)
author: Annie S.

description: Such a fun bar! There was live music on a boat, a rainstorm over the pool, dancing, and stiff tiki drinks. I came solo but still had a blast. The atmosphere is magical, and I am so glad I spent my Friday at this famous bar. Definitely recommended. It looks fun for groups because they have sharable drinks. I also overheard there is a secret menu, so I will have to check that out for next time.
author: Ann K.

description:
Seriously such a cool spot. Highly recommend this place for a fun night out!

I had been wanting to come here for awhile now and finally got around to it. We came here on the Sunday night before MLK day and it was bumpin'. SO many people. We wanted to get a table but we also wanted to be in the fun part of the bar so we decided to just walk in and wait for a spot at the bar, which we luckily found after about 5 minutes of hovering. 

There was live music when we came, which I am pretty sure they have every night of the week (besides Mondays and Tuesdays when they're closed). The band sits in a little hut in the middle of the pool (that's right, there's a pool in this place!). Extremely Instagram worthy I would say.

The bartenders were all super friendly too. They helped us when we had no idea what to order. 

DRINKS:
PINEAPPLE ROYALE ($13) - insanely delicious! I ordered the cheaper version of the drink, which comes in a ceramic pineapple vs. a real pineapple ($24). Perfect mix of pineapple, rum, and brandy. I would 100% order this drink again and again
SCORPION BOWL ($20 for 2 people) - love how this drink is served...in one big bowl with multiple long straws. 
SMUGGLER'S GOLDEN PUNCH BOWL ($22 for 2 people) - tasted like a moscow mule but with rum...it was amazing. I liked it better than the scorpion bowl. so much happiness

FOOD:
EDAMAME - Can't go wrong...always a great snack.
SLIDERS - so yummy! perfect amount when we weren't too hungry and needed some light bites

VIBES:
After we finished our (many) drinks, we headed to the dance floor. I felt like I was at a wedding/bar mitzvah. It was a hilarious group of people...most of which were on the older side (probably because this restaurant is in a hotel) but regardless we had so much fun! 

Head to Tonga Room ASAP. You will not be disappointed.
author: Ilana B.

description: Came here for my husbands bday. The food was super pathetic. They have a standing bar at the front where you can get drinks & appetizer, and enjoy the ambience & music which btw is great. I would highly recommend that over a full dinner.
author: Sindhu G.

description: If you're looking for a unique experience in SF, go to Tonga room for some drinks (we did not eat there). Drinks are expensive but good. Then and was fun to watch. And how about the people watching on the dance floor?! That made our evening.
author: Rob M.

description:
The Tonga Room is a tiny slice of island paradise in the middle of the city, and considered a San Francisco landmark by many. It's a perfect venue for a cheesy date, novel night out, or-let's be real-finding an excuse to get sloshed on Hurricanes. 

I'm very impressed by the band they have. This band, unlike many others, performs on a floating stage surrounded by waterfalls! I mean, how many bars can you say you've been to that provide that? 

All whimsical novelty aside, the Tonga Room also serves up some really fun and dangerously strong drinks. As the saying goes: "Time flies when you're having rum!" You'll surely lose track of time with the help of lava bowls, mai tais, and the many other tasty concoctions offered up here.
author: Stephen D.

description:
Love this place! 
Great ambiance And Chelsea the hostess was so wonderful. Got us in basically right away even though there was a wait. 
She was so sweet. 

Wings And pot stickers were great.
author: Cadey Lee E.

description:
This place gets a 5/5 for its atmosphere! It's inside the Fairmont Hotel. There's a beautiful lake in the middle of the restaurant and you are seated around it. There is a band that floats on a boat and sings/plays music while you eat. The music was too loud so it became difficult to hear the people around you/speak. Because there was a band playing while we ate, we had to pay a $5-7 surcharge (I can't remember the exact number) for it. This was automatically added onto our check per person. During our meal, there was fake rain that started falling alongside the lake which was pretty cool. It really felt like we were eating in a tiki hut right by the water, enjoying some nice music in the rain.

I got the kahlua pork and mm, the sauces that came with it were good! Can't really remember much from my dining experience foodwise, but it was overall a unique dining experience :)

There were a lot of random fees on our receipt that we didn't really expect. Like for example, I think they charged for alcohol..or idk..the way the receipt was formatted was so confusing.
author: Sydney C.

description: Came here for dinner with a group at the recommendation of some friends. It is definitely an experience, though I'm not sure how I feel about it. Food is overpriced and mediocre, drinks are lackluster and watered down and they charge you an entertainment fee (10$/person snuck into your already costly bill at the end) for the live (and very loud) band. Not sure I would come again but I'm sort of OK that we experienced it. That once. If you're into kind of a cheesy Hawaiian themed experience (felt like being in Epcot) with not so great food and some good people watching then this is your place. Some people seem to really love it and when we left there was a line to get in. Just not really my thing.
author: Debra D.

description: Been here a few times. Drinks used to be good. According to our bartender "new menu". Yeah. About the new drinks...may I suggest you not waste your hard earned drink $?! Perhaps you should RUN down to Chinatown and get a Chinese Mai tai and call it a day.! Our " monk went into a luau " was gross. No other words except no thank you.
author: La S.

description:
The Tonga Room is definitely more about atmosphere than about the food, but the atmosphere is so much fun! Drinks are strong, & the service was good. 

We had a party of 5 that arrived at 6:00 PM on a Saturday night. They told us it would be an hour & 15 minute wait, but we only waited an hour. The bar is standing room only, but we didn't mind hanging out. 

One thing to keep in mind - if you're still seated while they have live music playing, you will be charged a cover charge. It was $15 each for us.
author: Mindy T.

description:
Warning! Strong drinks! I repeat, strong drinks! 
A place to try at least once if you're in San Francisco. I got lucky because one reservation was available on the day I got to San Francisco. Anyway, sorry had to show off.
Like I said, drinks are strong and good! There was a band performing, and if you're having dinner, there is a $15 charge per person for the performance. Which is going to easily add up to your bill because drinks are pricey, not less than $18. And, plates are also on the pricier side. Just my boyfriend and I spent over $200. But, it was worth it. Quality of the food was great, performance with the fake rain was awesome! It was really fun! Great place for a date night or be with friends. 
The bar area, was over crowded. You can tell that it was really competitive to stand by the edge by the water. I'm glad I got a reservation.
My bf and I did try to get in there 2 hours early because we were hungry. But, the bar was a 1 hour 1/2 wait, and couldn't sit us in since there were other reservations. But, they gave us the option to wait in case someone cancelled their reservation. So we  left and came back, 30 min early to our reservation, again. But, this time we were seated. So it was a yey moment! Glad I got to check this place out. It was a lot of fun!
author: Melissa S.

description:
The hostesses last night were terrible. We waited for 50 minutes and got there on time to get seated. She sat us at the worst table she possibly could've. Right behind the band. My mom mentioned that she had an earache from being sick and she decided to lie to us and said that we would be fine because the speakers were facing the other way. It was so loud that even my ears started hurting. The worst part is is that there were many open tables for two that had a better view and were much quieter. You can't make reservations for less than 10 so why are those tables being reserved? I asked a hostess if we could move and she seemed very annoyed and said that all the other tables were "taken". I didn't mean to annoy anyone but it was so unpleasant that I wanted to leave ASAP. We drove an hour to get there. We wanted to get a good experience. And the tables were still open as we were leaving! I've worked as a hostess before and I know that if they wanted to they could've helped us more. 

But a few bad hostess doesn't change the fact that the restaurant is awesome. The whole room is gorgeous and makes you feel like you're in a tropical destination. The band was fun and played some good songs. Our server was really friendly, helpful, and sweet. The food was amazing and the drinks were creative.
author: Katherine F.

description:
Loved the boat in the middle of the room. Fun place. Fun place to bring kids for dinner. 

Those zombies tho...
author: Mark N.

description: Love the Tonga Room! We've been coming here for years. The atmosphere is wonderful, a very memorable experience. The drinks are absolutely the best. Great food, music, and service!
author: M. P.

description:
I've wanted to come here forever! This place is legendary and it claims to have the best happy hour in the city of San Francisco.

What a bust!

My wife and I had the happy hour buffet which, really, was a disappointment. After going two rounds I was done and hungry (And this is all your can eat!).

While the island-themed drinks are tasty I had more ice than alcohol. And, I felt sorry for the harried server who seemed to be running from table to table trying to make everyone happy and failing miserably.

Be fair warned: They don't take reservations and you don't want to stand and drink (There were too many people hovering near the happy hour bar).

Disappointing overall.
author: Ron C.

description: " what a disappointment and after walking up that steep hill .   After finally arriving was told it would take an hour wait . Well that wouldn't have been a problem if they were actually busy .  BUT every table reserved and very few occupied .  Which is " Crazy "
author: Catherine B.

description: Overrated expensive food and drinks. The food was so plain and the drink was overly sweet for a cocktail. The entertainment sound system was awful and too loud. It's mostly for tourists not local people. You can find better places in the city. Not going back here cuz it's not worth the money.
author: Lexie H.

description:
We had such high hopes!!! My husband and I spent the weekend in SF for the ballet and museums. Oh and I should mention we're big time tiki bar fans and always try new places wherever we vacation. Though recommendations we received (from a well-respected tiki bartender) steered us *away* from Tonga Room at the Fairmont Hotel, we decided to try it anyway because it was in the neighborhood and served food. Bad idea. VERY. BAD. IDEA. Horrible food (cold, greasy, inedible.) Worst tiki drinks I've ever had... virtually no alcohol OR flavor. Look, I'm no bartender, but even I could make a better tiki drink (blindfolded mind you) than we had. No I'm not done ranting yet. The "music: (a live band -
hence the $15 cover charge at the door) wasn't just awful.... they were awful, Awful, AWFUL! Out of tune pop covers from the 70's. If that wasn't bad enough, the wait staff was weary and clearly bored, the customers were mostly out-of-their-mind drunk tourists dancing badly right next to tables, and the carpets/furniture looked like it needed a deep cleaning. Sure, it's been around since the 40's, but Tonga Room is way, WAY tired. The Fairmont should be ASHAMED of what they've let this place become.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Just stopped in for a drink, didn't eat. Had the 1944 Mai Tai and watched several iterations of the indoor rain/thunderstorm over the pool.  

No line to get in (6pm on a Thursday), looked like plenty of open tables if we had wanted to eat, and lots of room to move around at the bar/dance floor.  Would be nice to come back when they have live music.

All and all, a lovely experience, definitely from another era.
author: Andrea G.

description:
This is my second time visiting the Tonga Lounge. It is located at the Fairmont Hotel on the bottom "T" floor. I only came for the drinks and upon walking in I felt like I left the city of San Francisco. They did a really great job with the decor, lighting, and making you feel like you're on a tropical vacation.

The bar area is pretty small. They offer numerous drinks to share for 2-4 people served in tropical-like cups/bowls such as coconuts or pineapples. We ordered the scorpion bowl for two, but since I'm not really into fruity tropical drinks, it is difficult for me to say whether or not I enjoyed the drink. For those that do enjoy fruity drinks you might enjoy the Tonga lounge for they offer a variety of tropical drinks. They were very sweet and not too strong.

The $20 Scorpian Bowl may look intimidating to drink for two but in actuality we were able to finish it in 10 minutes because it was full of ice. If you're with a group of friends or on a date I'd recommend this place for its ambiance.
author: Frank T.

description:
Call me lame, but I loved this place. Came here with a few friends on my last night in SF for some post-dinner/dessert/second dinner drinks.

Strong yet tasty cocktails (mine came in a ceramic pineapple!), a POOL in the middle of the restaurant with Hawaiian-shirt sporting live performers on a boat in the middle of it, and palapas that function as seating. At one point it started to "rain" inside, and I knew that I'd found my happy place. There's also a very spacious and mostly empty dance floor if the mood strikes.
author: Yuting Z.

description: Our friends had a table held for us, we were in another Uber but the BItches  at the door wouldn't let us in so we waited for another 1/2 hour just saying
author: Jack W.

description: Finally got this off my bucket list and was underwhelmed.  Went for a pre dinner drink at 5pm on Sat nite. Check-in hostess was on the phone taking a reservation and didn't even give us eye contact to acknowledge us for three minutes. Bad 1st impression. It was disappointing when she told us it's standing room only in the bar. The entire restaurant was empty. I guess dinner service had not started. Bartender was super friendly. Glad I saw it, but nothing makes me want to return.
author: Erin M.

description: The ambiance was great we loved the band on a boat. Food was ok 6/10 joes crab shack quality drinks were very strong. All and all a good experience one of those check off the list restaurants. Will I go back? no but it was fun.
author: Brian B.

description: Wings were cold, soup had no flavor, my fried rice had hard rice and wasn't that great. The short ribs were boneless and rare would of had cooked lit longer if it was stated on menu.  Said from grill NO nothing about that meat was from grill..
author: Shaleen L.

description:
Ok. If you head to the tonga room, go to the bar. Do not make reservations! We've been twice and the experience at the bar was by far the best. Just drink and hang around. 

The food was on par with what is served at Applebee's and is 3x the cost. While that along wouldn't solicit 2 stars, the service was sh*t. It was honestly the worst service I've had in the states. 

Go to the bar and you'll have 5 stars. Get a reservation and it would not be worth ranking.
author: Nick C.

description: Came here with the fam for dinner. Tiki decor with a pirate ship and rain(thunder included). We should up around 6 wait was estimated at 1 hr. We waited 45 mins. Drinks were expensive for what I got, but they do have some giant fish bowls that looked interesting. Ordered steak,mahi-mahi , wings, and lemon chicken. The steak and Mahi-mahi were delicious, cooked perfectly. The wings were bland and the lemon chicken had a strong lemon taste. There is a boat in the middle of the restaurant that floats up and down with a live band( which u pay extra per person to watch). The band was entertaining and interacted with the customers. Will go back minus the kids, They didn't really enjoy it.
author: Adriana S.

description:
Not what it used to be.

You have to make a reservation weeks ahead of time if you want a table at an optimal time on weekends. Which is fine, means the food must be good right? I guess. Maybe. Meh.

Stay away from the appetizers. We had the vegetable potstickers and they lacked flavor. They were hard, leathery, and cold and filled with flavorless paste. As for the Pok-Pok wings, Ive had better chicken wings from the deli at Safeway.

For main's my wife had the short rib, which was probably the best Ive tried anywhere, very tender and juicy. I had the porterhouse steak. It was a little over cooked and WAY too salty. It had a nice Asian flavor but it was hard to taste through all the salt. 

This place is known for their Tiki theme, great drinks, and live music performances. Its pretty much the only reason to come. In fact, some people ONLY come for the music, dancing and drinks at the bar area. They have a dancefloor that gets really packed and people even wait in line outside just to get in like you'd expect at some fancy night club. 

If you come and spend an evening here with friends you'll have a great time. 

But what put me off about this place was the $15 pp charge for the live music. I would be fine paying this if I just came here to have a drink and enjoy the music. But to have to pay even if you are having dinner here is kinda ridiculous if you ask me. Between the 4 of us we shared 3 appetizers, we each ordered a main course, and shared 3 large drink bowls ($50+ each). Just for food and bev we spent around $400. Do you really need to charge us an additional $60??? It aint like Bruno Mars was performing or anything.

This is an overpriced 2 star restaurant. But I added a star for the awesome drinks, music and fun atmosphere.
author: Rimar T.

description: I love this place something fierce. It's such a cool gem in an amazing city. I took my bosses coworkers here when we were in town for a conference and everyone was super impressed with the atmosphere as well as the food. The drinks are so fun as well and it rains inside. Love it!
author: Sara R.

description:
Kitschy fun, it is worth going just to see the band launch themselves on the lagoon barge at 8 pm and play a set. Not a cheap night out, but where else can you experience a tropical rainstorm every 15 minutes? The Hurricane drinks are the best deal. Service is very pleasant and on island time, so you can sit, sip, and overlook the lagoon with no worries. 
My husband and I love tiki bars, but next time we will come early and grab a seat for happy hour rather than make  dinner reservations as we did this visit, (which are a must, otherwise you are standing in a long line). For dinner, we enjoyed the large serving of tasty calimari appetizer, the green beans and the pork. Either way, it is a fun night out. Plus, wandering through the Fairmont lobby and gardens is a must.
author: Debra R.

description:
I'd say it's pretty much a $50 per person Panda Express with tropical decor and live music. I ordered beef. The chuck was too big and not tender enough to chew, and there is no knife.

Lastly, go over your bill before you pay. We have a party of 3, but the waitress brought a bill with cover charge for 4.
author: James B.

description:
Surrounding an indoor pool stands an array of palm trees and tiki huts, giving this bar located in the Fairmont Hotel a lovely Polynesian atmosphere. There was live music at several points in the evening, and the raining water in the pool was also a nice touch. My company hosted our holiday party here, and we had a section of the restaurant blocked off for us with an open bar and a selection of food. The mai tai was a nice drink, served in a fake coconut and not short on the rum! I was less a fan of the spice killer, which was a bit overpowered with spices. 

We had a buffet line of appetizers, dinner, and dessert, and for me, the food left something to be desired. The vegetable spring rolls and shiitake egg rolls were decent to start with, and the chicken wings and pork ribs were pretty standard and decent bar fare as well. However, I found the mahi mahi quite dry, and the Mongolian beef, the chicken, and the chow mein quite flavorless. For dessert, the chocolate mousse wasn't bad, but the mini-cheesecakes and pineapple upside-down cake (with barely any pineapple) weren't particularly memorable. In sum, this is definitely a place to come much more for the unique and lively atmosphere, rather than the food.
author: David K.

description: Come here for the ambiance and not the food. I love the vibe of this place with the thatched roofs, canoes, and pool with fake rain/lightning to set the mood. Hubby and I thought we were in for a special treat. Well, then the food came. The food is very disappointing with heavily fried items that are overcooked so all the moisture is sucked from them. Rib meat was also dry. My husband ordered a virgin cocktail and it was nearly all ice with about 2 Tbsp of drink in a tall glass. $10 for a couple of sips of drink! Overall, this is a place I would only go for ambiance and entertainment if the band was good, but not for the food. On the plus side, hosts and servers were nice.
author: Goldi J.

description: This place is always packed. Poor communication between staff and customers and unorganized. They do not accept reservations for dinner unless its a party of ten or more.  Doors open at 5 and it is currently 6:30 and every table in the dining room is empty so lots of people standing around. You have to put your name on the waitlist for a dinner table and a bar table. Cool ambiance but not worth it with so many other options in the city. Expected so much more for an establishment in the Fairmont.
author: Sandi W.

description: So cute and a must see if you are in San Francisco! Delish cocktails and perfect for Happy Hour!
author: Susan C.

description: Really loud, but really fun! Great food, quick service, fantastic live music, awesome decor! Would love to come back!
author: Kelly R.

description: Wayyy too expensive. Paid a big fee per person just to sit down. Half the restaurant was empty. The music was cheesy and terrible.
author: Marie E.

description:
It was a Wednesday night, and I was already at the Fairmont Hotel with my colleagues for a business seminar and we decided to dine at the Tonga Room since we heard such great things about it. 

We did not have reservations so we were seated in the bar area. The bar area did not include a full dinner menu, just the limited bar food menu and drinks. We ordered the ahi poke, teriyaki wings, short rib sliders, fried rice, edamame, and bulgogi lettuce wraps. The food came out slowly since the small tables in the bar area could not accommodate more than two plates at a time.  The taro chips that came with the ahi poke tasted stale and old. It was crunchy and soggy at the same time. The teriyaki wings was overly salty. The short rib in the sliders were so tough you could not even bite into it without pulling the whole piece of meat out. The bulgogi was as tough as the short ribs. Edamame is edamame, you can't really mess that up. The fried rice was decent and was the only thing I liked about this meal.

I also ordered a lychee martini and it was made with vodka instead of sake, which is more common, and it did not taste good at all. My next drink was the pineapple royal, which was just rum and pineapple juice. This was pretty good.

The bill came out to be over $160 and that is ridiculously expensive for some bar food and 3 drinks. They also had entertainment that night so it was $5 per person.

The atmosphere and concept is cool which merits them 2 stars but the price and quality of food is definitely not there.

Anthony Bourdain may have featured this restaurant but trust me and save yourself by NOT coming here.

Total disappointment.
author: Lena V.

description:
TIKI TIKI TIKI DRINK!

My wife and I are huge fans of Tiki and the recent revival of the scene has definitely put a spotlight on the historic Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar located in The Fairmont Hotel. In it's 70th year of operation, this place has not lost any of its charm. From the band floating on the water, the rainstorms, and of course, the potent concoctions coming from the bar. 

Standing room only at the bar, no problem. We were greeted immediately with a friendly barkeep who was more than happy to make us a few classics. A Mai Tai here, a Painkiller there, Zombie... then things get fuzzy. William was kind enough to show us an extensive list of tiki drinks that aren't on the regular menu.

It's got all the right ingredients. It's dark and cozy, the music, minimal cellular reception, you could stay here for hours and not know what day it is. Such a great atmosphere, and a good time. We are definitely looking forward to coming back!
author: Aaron P.

description:
I wouldn't be back for the food. I had the sliders on the appetizer menu and that was enough for me to know that I won't be trying their food again.    I will probably make sure I eat before I come next time. The drinks are strong. You have been warned. 

There is a $5 surcharge for the entertainment.  Also the sporadic rainfall is unique.  The night I went the music wasn't popping like other reviews have mentioned.  Was I not drunk enough? Do they start slow and get better as the night continues? If I'm back in the city it wouldn't be the first place I rush to come back but if I'm the neighborhood I probably will drop by for some drinks.
author: Iris A.

description: This is the biggest tourist trap outside of Pier 39.  Over priced average Chinese food. They won't seat you until 6pm hoping you will buy a $15-20 drink. Parking at the hotel is a whooping $50. Do your pallet and pocket book a favor and find a good Chinese restaurant in Chinatown.
author: Tim G.

description: Saw this place on AB's Parts Unknown. The original plan was to have a drink, check it off the list and move on to another spot. 3 drinks later, we ended up closing the place down. The live band was amazing and entertaining, playing the likes Bruno mars, Carlos Santana, and some old skool jams. Drinks were stiff, but a bit pricey ($17-24 per). We had an absolute blast dancing our asses off. Def would come check it out again.
author: Jesse L.

description:
Pros:  

Live band was awesome
Chinese waitress was amazing and really good at what she does
Ambiance was fun

Cons:

Food wasn't edible.  We ordered the crab cakes, which was essentially hot crabs with mayo on it and it was cold in the middle.  Not sure if it was the hot mayo, but my husband got food poisoning that night and we had to leave our event early.  He felt sick until the next day.

I also ordered the 48 hour Korean ribs which was just ok, but at least more edible than the crab cakes.

Along with 2 glasses of wine and 2 beers, our 1 entree and 1 appetizer came out to $120.  We stopped ordered food since it just wasn't that good.  Our awesome waitress noticed us not eating and took the crab cakes off the bill for us, so extra star for them.

We were staying at the Fairmont and the front desk girl said they have a new chef that's going to revamp the 2 restaurants onsite.  

I hope so as the Tonga Room really is cute and fun!
author: Vi Y.

description: Went here on Friday night and really enjoyed the atmosphere out here! So first of all coming to the decor. As soon as you enter the place you will fall in love with it. They have a pool in between and a boat in there where the live music is place. Mind you, do not be jumping in the pool, there is a fine! There is a cover charge of $15 per person if you want to sit at the table and order food during the live music nights! There aint no cover charge if you just want to order drinks and be on the dance floor. Food wise, we ordered the vegetable pot stickers, kung pao tofu and the key lime layer cake. The pot stickers and the cake was decent, but I loved the kung pao tofu. Only I wish they would have more vegetarian options on their menu. Being a vegetarian there are only about 3-4 options on their menu. Coming to the drinks I ordered the mai tai and it was extremely strong!!!! The service was good too. It can get really busy here and they do not take reservations. But for us we were told that there would be a 45 minute wait, but we were seated on our table within 15 minutes of arrival! Overall a very good place for a date night!
author: Nibha K.

description: This bar used to be one of my favorite places in SF because it is just so beautiful, with the pool and rain.  But now, it's just lame.  The crowd is just a bunch of old people. The food is fast food in quality, with high-end prices.  The drinks are subpar, but very expensive.  The service is horrible, you can tell their employees hate working there - I don't blame them.  The music is what my parents listened to in the Seventies.  Their live bands are not very good.  There is also no affordable parking in the area, which makes going their really inconvenient.  I recommend going their to take a selfie or Snapchat and then leaving - not worth your time or money.
author: Ghazal S.

description:
Uh-maz-ing. 

Whiskey laden Tiki drinks, a floating stage with a full live band, and decorations that resemble Gilligan's Island set pieces. 

If the above isn't enough to entice you to visit this amazing spot, you might be dead inside. The Tonga room is located in the Nob Hill area of San Francisco, just inside the Fairmount Hotel. 

The room where the actual Tiki fun takes place used to be an old indoor swimming area, which by the way leads me to the floating stage. Where the pool used to be is now a musical lagoon, the stage floats out to the middle of it with a three piece band that plays covers of old lounge standards and few eighties hits to get the dance floor moving. 

They do serve all the Tiki drink classics like Mai Tais, Scorpion bowls, Hurricanes, Zombies, Chi-Chis, and the Singapore Sling. I'm not a rum drinker, but the bartender was cool enough to make me a whiskey based Tiki drink. I think it was called the, "The Dirty Tourist". Kidding! 

Next time I'm here I'll have to try some Tonga Room island dishes.
author: Nate M.

description: The atmosphere in this place is awesome.  We got there right when they opened to bypass any crowd or cover charge.  The Pupu Platter was delicious, but the drinks were not anything to write home about.  You couldn't even taste the alcohol.
author: Allison C.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend and his friends. At first, it was hard to find this place. We just went into our best-guessed entrance and luckily found it!

Great thing there was no cover, but when we went out to go to the bathroom and went back in, it seemed like they required it.

We ordered about five of those huge drinks for four people. I don't remember because we got really drunk off of that...

Expect long lines and rude bartenders. Other than that, we had a great time!

I thought it was really cool that the band here played on a floating boat in the middle of the room and they played classics.

Might come back here!
author: Aj C.

description: The wait for a table was too long, so we didn't get food but there was plenty of standing room in the bar area. I liked the cocktails and the live music was great!
author: Katie K.

description:
After living in SF for 13 years and being on the verge of moving away, this was on my bucket list. So we put together a group for a birthday celebration and gave it a lash. 

First of all, the hotel and the bar/restaurant are beautiful. Great vibe, spacious dining area. 5 stars.

The drinks are stiff and tasty, but a wee bit pricey. 4 stars

The process of reserving a table , signing a contract in advance, and ordering food in advance was painful and unpleasant. NEGATIVE 3 stars.

The food was terrible. The wings and ribs were dry and chewy, the rice was average, the veggies were bland. The prawns were some of the worst I have ever tasted. Easily one of the worst tasting meals I have ever had in SF. NEGATIVE 3 stars.

Then came the bill....140 dollars per person for a moderate amount of terrible food, and several good strong drinks each. Yes, the ambience and space are very good, but the terrible quality of food made this an experience I would not recommend, especially at that price I felt embarrassed that I organized this event. NEGATIVE 2 stars
author: Theodore N.

description: Very beautiful place something diffrent from the rest the crab cake was amazing i really recommend this place i was there with my gf b day celebration and tge service was amazing
author: Arkadi B.

description:
Total tourist attraction. If you really want to check this place out for the ambiance, come here just to check it out -- don't order anything and don't get a table. Just enjoy the atmosphere and leave. Here's why:

THERE ARE TOO MANY RULES. Honestly, I hope the manager gets fired and someone with actual sense about customer experience re-vamps this place. Some of the rules we encountered last night:

1. No sitting in the bar/standing area. My friend was feeling a little dizzy and grabbed a chair to sit down. Multiple waiters came and hassled her to stand up. She was not blocking anybody and just needed to sit for a few minutes since there was a long wait for a table. Nope, she had to stand.

2. If you want to wait for a table, you can't put your name down. You have to stand in line the entire time to be seated.

3. If you ordered a drink at the bar, you can't wait for a table because they "can't" bring the drinks to your table.

4. No ordering food at the standing/bar area.

5. You can't sit at the small tables at the standing area, the hostess needs to seat you because apparently they're ALL RESERVED.

6. You need to pay right away. Otherwise they will take away your drinks and treat you like a bad child if you don't.

Apparently, the Tonga Room is a hot spot for people who feel the need to impose their authority on customers since they probably have miserable, powerless personal lives at home. It's appalling to see how they don't care about customer satisfaction at all. What's the point of having a business if you just want to make up 5023874301 rules to impose -- why don't you just move to North Korea? You can buddy up with other dictators to make other people miserable.

Honestly, one of the worst experiences I've ever had. Not to mention that punch bowls with minimal alcohol cost close to $40 and the carpeted floor in the standing area is SO STICKY. My friend, who was the birthday girl, could barely walk around cause her shoe was stuck to the floor and her foot kept slipping out!! I wanted to get the names of the servers and write a complaint to fairmont but since it was my friend's birthday and our buzz was already dissipated, I didn't want to add to the fire.

I will never be back and I hope other yelpers who read this review will heed my warning -- DON'T GO. If you think a bad experience is worth seeing "rain" aka SPRINKLERS come on and a mediocre cover band, then please be my guest. Otherwise, there are plenty of better options with better price points and better customer service in SF.
author: Sharon C.

description: These guys can't make cocktails to save their life. No matter what we tried everything was too bitter or too sour.
author: Jim H.

description: I love love love this place. My favorite waiter is David. He is amazing. The service is always on point with him. I love the ambiance & the band is amazing.  Come here at least once a month.
author: Ginger G.

description:
Made a reservation three and a half weeks in advance and the earliest I could get a table for 6 was 9:30 PM on Friday, May 5. Ok, that's fine it'll work.

Arrive in time and the hostess tells me there's a $10 cover for each person at the table, even though I had a reservation. This is horse crap to me. I'm already here paying to eat and have drinks AND you're making me pay a cover, when I made the reservation? Why doesn't it say this anywhere? Aside from the atmosphere the Mahi Mahi was decent. Zombie drink was weak in flavor. 

Service was mediocre and we were rushed to place our food orders since the kitchen closes at 10 PM. 

Yeah it's fun to sit inside and scream at the person across from you at the table because you can't hear due to the live band.

Overpriced and an extra $40 for cover on top of our bill was not what I wanted for my birthday dinner.
author: Malika H.

description:
Go here for the experience. Go here for the live music on a floating island band in the middle of the venue. Go here for the Hawaiian experience. Sit back , order a pu pu platter, order a gigantic fish bowl and you're set.

 Yes they charge an entertainment fee for $10 p/p.. but, for its location, this place is reasonably priced. The price tag comes with the territory. The territory well justified it.
author: Dhruv B.

description: This restaurant and bar has an extremely tropical theme.  It is very eclectic with the Polynesian feel and jazz music on a floating boat.  I remember seeing this bar on Anthony Bourdain for one of the first times.  When I saw him there drinking the fruity but strong drinks, I told myself I need to make my way there.  So during the night you can find yourself seated along the makeshift lake oasis and will hear violent thunder storms with rain that is near.  In addition a live band will play around the oasis pool and get the customers into the music.  There is an area where people can dance and also the lovely bar area where you can stand or sit.  This is a must do place that you have to visit at least one in your life to be a part of the indoor rain experience.
author: Mercedes M.

description: Randy and I enjoying our nice dinner at the Tonga room! Happy anniversary Before heading to the Tonga room we explored the garden room at the Fairmont Hotel, highly recommended because of the landscape view you get during sunset! Just breathe taking :) both of us were surprised for the Sunday Live event. Really spectacular. Played a variety of classics my ultimate fav is Frank Sinatra. We had the Tonga platter that served fishy finger foods like sweet ribs, egg rolls, wings, and fried crab leg. Then ordered two luau drinks plus we got our anniversary mini cake. My night was full of dancing and quality time with Randy. Great experience :)
author: Evelyn O.

description:
I am giving one star for the ambiance and the drinks which were top notch. My Wife booked the reservation and was only able to get 9:30 pm.  I thought, it's a little late but it must be good. 
 What a disappointment!  When we sat down we were told that the kitchen is about to close so we better hurry up and order. WTF? Why do you have a reservation and then do that to the guests? It did not get any better after that. The food was downright bad, the kahula pork was inedible.  I don't know who wrote those other reviews but they went to a different place.  My advice is to go for drinks only.
author: G B.

description:
This is a great place for drinks with friends. On our recent visit to San Francisco we waited in line for almost an hour and I started to wonder if it was even worth it at some point, but we persevered. 

The atmosphere is fun and there is a dance floor and even a band. We enjoyed some incredibly strong drinks and we had an even more incredible time because we were having great conversation with friends. 

Worth a visit, even with a wait.
author: Emily R.

description: Drinks are ok, acquires a certain taste or maybe it wasn't made properly but the food was way better. The vibe and atmosphere was great with the thunder pounding in the room then comes the rainfall. I just have drinks from the bar upstairs near the lobby.
author: Randy A.

description: My ankle was sprained and the bartender cut me off assuming I was drunk. He was completely rude and inappropriate. I doubt I will be back again.
